Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, through its fulfillment in me, and through its expositions and declarations, it has become clear to me that you will understand this treatise, which is a part of the operation with the hand, i.e., surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation of the hand is nearly unknown in our realm and time, having been deprived of it almost entirely, while those who know something about it have distorted its science, and its procedures are obscured; only a few small descriptions of it remain in the books of the Ancients, which confuse the matter and lead to error and uncertainty, so that the understanding of it is blocked and its force and art diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has seemed good to me that I should animate this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it might come with the forms of the tools of cautery and other instruments of the work as they are through the addition of the declaration, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why no one is adept with their hand in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and its practitioner must be exercised in the science of anatomy, which knows the parts of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the tendons, and the number of them, and their movement; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and their places of emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so Hypocrites says that though his name is small, in the work he is great, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not learned in what we have said about anatomy, it has been made clear that he should not fall into error, by which men will die, as I have seen many of them, for some are formed in this science and yet stray from it without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw an experienced fool of a doctor pierce a scrophula on a woman's neck, and pierce some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died under his hand.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who pulled out a stone from a man who was in great pain, and the stone was large; he came to him and extracted that stone with a fragment of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called for them to stop extracting it, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he treated a black slave who had a fracture in his thigh; and preparing with his ignorance, he extracted the fracture over the plague with powders and splints with strong compression, and did not let the plague breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he healed according to his desires, and he bound it, and let it be for several days, and commanded that I should not loosen the bandage; and so it stayed as it was, and the thigh and the leg became pustular, and it came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bandage; and after there was tranquility and he was eased of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption wandered in the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous ulcer, and it festered for some days, until the wickedness of it increased with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the black humor is pure in its melancholy, therefore it does not come to it with fire at all, but rather that it is in a member which suffers from everything that is hostile to it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And so, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation of the hand should be understood in two ways: one is operation which is associated with health, and the other is work with which the greatest dispositions are endangered.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already exhorted this in every place of this book where there is error and fear; so it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave that, so that fools do not hinder the way of speaking and disgracing you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with zeal and with the protection of God, and your diseases with facility and with firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way by the grace of God so that health and laudable success may result, and put aside terrible diseases of difficult cure, and wield your weapons against what makes you fearful, so that idleness in your faith and in your name does not leave you: for it remains to your glory, and more in the world and beyond to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulias already said in some of his maxims:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat ill diseases ill, so that bad doctors are not named."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have composed this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered on the head, in the forms of the instruments and the tools of cauteries, and of what is necessary in operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of bleeding and piercing, and of cupping, and of plasters, and of extraction of thorns and like things, all chaptered and ordered in the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of torque and like things; a chapter ordered on the head, in the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and remembrance of operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I shall say what the quality is of the ingredients of that cautery and of the things in it, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the ingredient of cautery and of the thing in it is long and prolix, and subtle by science, and secret hidden; and much has been spoken about it by many wise men, and from it they have disagreed, and for me a little of their speeches is enough, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers universally on all complections, save two complektions which are caustic complektions without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the caustic and dry complection with material they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial for it, and others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in disease which is by quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and what is convenient is that disease caustic and dry be healed with what is cauted and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he said the contrary of that, that by cautery is made remedy in all disease caustic and dry which is seen in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its humidities to the complection of fire, you rub the body of man.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the speech of that, that experiment that has been discovered to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it is not necessary to come upon this anyone who has already been demonstrated and exercised in the chapter of cauterization by former exercise, and has known the diversity of the complexions of men and the disposition of diseases in them, and their causes, and their accidents, and the space of time of them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions there is no need for fear, especially in damp and moist diseases, for all doctors have agreed on these, and they do not disagree about using cauterization to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And understand, sons, that the secret of curing by cauterization with fire and its goodness is that it is a simple substance whose action does not extend to the members joined to the one cauterized, and it does not affect any other member except with a slight injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine extends to other members, and it strongly brings about a difficult-to-cure disease in them, and strongly weakens them.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except to cause it to superfluous. And we have known through experience and through long service in studying the truth of causes, and so I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not for my not being free to read this hidden secret to you with fire, and the quality of its operation on bodies and its expulsion through which you expel diseases, by philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be acute in your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And understand, sons, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to do cauterization, and they pause at the best time in spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, as long as the harm caused by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn by cauterization, and especially if the cauterization is for pain or necessary pains, strong and violent, which do not tolerate delay for fear of evil, which is greater than slight harm coming through the weather.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And know this, or, sons, that which is not believed except by the common people and foolish doctors, it is that to that disease which is healed by cauterization there is no reduction at all time, and they pause at the consequent one.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think through that, for cauterization is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moistnesses which are the cause of the pains coming.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cauterization surpasses medicine through willingness in its strength and virtue of its operation, and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease will return at some time of the year, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the disease, and its strength, and what has been prepared in his body through the gathering of superfluities in him, and what he has received from him in food and likeness from those causes; but that disease for which cauterization is administered is a subtle disease in members with few superfluities and moistnesses, thus as cauterization for toothache and its like to it, it is possible that this pain will not return in him, but what happens in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a true speech, not that they understand in it, for they believe that there is no cure that benefits from medicine or anything else except cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the methods of curing in certain diseases, and those medicines do not confer it, and then at the end of the cause, we administer hom cautery, and it benefits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here we see that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they say that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they do not say this except for the equality of gold and subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cauterization does not matter, even though it is absolutely true, for I have seen and proven that it only happens in some bodies without the others, and cauterization with it is good and better than with iron as they say; but when you do cauterization with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, for it is heated according to the quantity that you want through the roughness of the gold, and prepares to receive heat; and if you put on fire some leaves so that the craftsman sees through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterization with iron is done to us more lightly and closer to the correctness of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have arranged this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and have arranged those of the head among the feet, so that they may ask him for what they want from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization of headache pain due to coldness and moistness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers with moistness and coldness the superficial accident of which it has two causes, it is caused by soda and multitude of fluxes, called corissa, from the parts of the ears and nostrils flowing, and multitude of sleep, and toothache and of the gullet, and universally of all disease that comes through coldness, thus with paralysis, stroke, and its like in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first of all, order the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine three or four times, depending on the strength of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that he washes his head with water, and then let him sit between your knees on a low bench, and place his hands over his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm close to the tip of the nose between your eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if after three days it has not arrived, mark that location with ink, and then light the cauterization olive, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place it over the location marked by ink, in such a way that it descends, and your hand be forced little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the location, and if you see some amount of the head, thus as the amount of grains of sand, then lift your hand again, and if it does not return to your hand with that iron, with another one, if it is cold, between what has been seen by you that I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the location and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place on it wet cotton in vinegar and let it sit there until the fire ash is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the location with tetraceutical ointment once it has healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the Roman plaster is open, as many miles are added to the distance, for it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the head be cauterized within the eye socket and have the cauterization within the eye socket as it is attached to some part of the brain.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then it is cut that which is attached to the bone, and then it is healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that with the cautery they come to the end, while they press on the strong bone as they enter it, and this is the form of small Alfecat.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they consider that from that location they expel the vapor from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound is open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery at all, except in some men according to the way of fear; and leaving that aside, for me it is better for health when there is no pain, since the head is relieved through solution of continuity as we have testified in other members, and especially when the nature of the patient's head is of a phlegmatic nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better for me, and it is used and works with health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head there occurs chronic and long-lasting pain and this is prolonged in the patient, using serots and clysters and head-purges and plasters and poultices and bandages and herbs and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery which we count and does not benefit him from any of those causes, then consider that if the nature of the patient's head is of a strong creation in its nature; and it is phlegmatic and finds great heat in it, then cauterize it with another cautery after that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize it on the crown of his head with a cautery so that the vein is cut.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The vein is cut and the quantity which we have counted is revealed and cauterized with a cautery in the back of the head in the place which is called the vessel — and it is that place where a leech is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And you put your hand on it, and do not reveal the bone, for the patient will find much greater pain from that than from all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say this cautery in its place, for the cautery with which you cautarize the horns of the head and the occiput is more subtle cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is how it is done.
Capitol ters.	Chapter third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cautery of recent and not antique emigration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When in the front of the head there is painful swelling, or pain extends to the eye, the head should be evacuated with cleansing medicines, and other treatment should be administered, which I have described in the chapters on diseases; and if all does not help, cautery in it is in two ways: either cautery with an acute burning medicine, or with a hot iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cautery with a burning medicine is that you take a piece of wool and char it, and scrape away its edges and bind the ends of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the place of pain in the temple with a pointed lance so that it is made under the vein and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then tighten it with a tight bandage, leaving that aside for the space of three hours; then loosen it and treat the ash, leaving the wound for two or three days, and then put cold water on it until the place becomes swollen.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then heal it with ointment as it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written in the two treaties of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cautery with an iron is done according to this way: heat for cautery, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a closed key, for the head of it is thus shaped like a key in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then pause over the place of pain, and hold your hand — so that it is not burnt by the iron which is below — and move the hot iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is burnt by the heat of the vein thus according to its nature and size, and raise your hand so that the artery below is not burnt, so that there comes no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak a bandage in salt water and pause it over the place, leaving that for three days; then pause the bandage moistened with wine, and heal with ointment as it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the end of the scalpel according to cautery, and beware of incision of artery in this recent and not antique emigration.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cautery of ancient emigration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat emigration with what we have said of the preceding treatment, and what we have said in the chapters on diseases, and the treatment does not help, and you see that the disease is not satisfied by it according to what we have said of the first cautery with medicine or of cautery with fire, then when you ignite the cautery-scalpel so that it is whitened, push it onto the place of pain with a line of length according to its size, or as much as that; and raise your hand by a pathway and tighten it so that you cut the artery and it comes into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary for you to beware of the continuation of the mandible which is gnawed by chewing, and that the ligament not be burnt and the nerve which gnaws that, and that no spasms come.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is upon the custody and caution of flow of blood from the artery which is cut, for in the cutting of it there is danger, and especially to him who ignores what he does and is not experienced and educated; leave the operation at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with remembrance of the rule of flow of blood from the artery according to his own way, in his own place of this free book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see of this disease that it does not help that cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize him in the middle place of the head as we have counted, and heal the wound as it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on stretching of artery with cautery having two edges, and this cautery is better and more potent.
Capitol .v.	Chapter fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cautery for pains of ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from heat and it is treated with lytic causes and with other treatment which I have said in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery and this is called puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then push the point of ignition and it is carried into the whole ear as it is turned, or in the circuit of whichever part if the pain is in whichever part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Take it away with the cautery of the edge of the ear a little by little as you test the place with touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points in all the ears, and whichever part, then heal the places as they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter sixth.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cautery for tetter.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tetter which is healed and cautery of it is not but of the spices which come through phlegm, according to what we have said in the chapters on diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Beware of cautery of the species that comes through drying or through spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this type of torture with chains and whipings and threats, and your cure does not work, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: you must apply the first one at the root of the ear, the second one below his temple, and the third one at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, because softening only occurs in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way to perform cauterization is to cauterize the patient on the right side of the upper part of the ear, a little above the horn of the head, and another one on the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger toe, and place your hand with the cautery until half of the amount of the thickness of the skin is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of cauterization, and it is the specialty of the surgeon, the shape of his tool being like a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But in fact, it is more subtle: when you see that there is too much thickness, you should cut a little bit into the patient.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with what is called the direct process until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On cauterization for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said and your medicine does not work, and the patient does not have fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: on both horns of his head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the middle part of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cauterization is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and it should be treated with what has already been said.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization for oblivion caused by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient at the beginning large whips and purifying pills.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then scrape the whole head of the patient and place on his neck a plaster made from cedar resin, as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply this several times, because this is the way to cauterize.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the order of medicines which we have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he gets better with that, good; and if not, then do to him three cauteries on the back part of his head, which descend from the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and treat the cauteries with what has been said.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you think that he can bear it and the patient can tolerate it, then do to him a cautery in the middle part; and if you see greater tolerance, then cauterize him on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped according to the form given above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterization for paraplegia and on softening all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Give the patient whips and purifying pills in the head as we have said; then scrape his head and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle part of the head, and with a cautery on both horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of him, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body and the patient can tolerate it, and the disease is strong, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and lastly with a cautery until half of the thickness of the skin is burned, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that until it is healed, and let this be an olive-shaped cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so give the brain of him at the beginning whips and the other treatment which we have said in the division when the patient is large and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who does not suffer from medicines, then administer healing and masticables, before which for several days there should be benefit from food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then scrape the head of the patient, and cauterize him with a cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery on his occipital bone, and on each horn of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize him with cauteries as we have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive-shaped according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and phlegm, then cauterize him with cauteries as we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive decline into melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him what purifies his brain according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then scrape the head of the patient, and properly make a torch made of lye over the circle, and then place it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be for sixty days, and let him be held from every side.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then give him a lining; and it is more worthy to make an old sheep’s udder.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with moderate heat according to measure, as long as he can tolerate it when it is on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place that in the middle part of his head over the circle, and rub it until it is warm.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that with the patient once a week for a month, and let him have his other regime as long as he is better; or if you want, cauterize him making small points according to his age, unless you hold your hand with a cautery in this way: this is a special cautery which moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then give that cut in a bag made of wool or in a towel of flannel.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization for water descending into the navel.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you see the beginning of water in the navel because of phlegm as we have said in the division, then begin and give the patient what purifies his head, and guard him from all humors.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that sweat in a bath made of vinegar for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command that he wash his head, and cauterize him with a cautery in the middle part of the head; and then cauterize him with two cauteries on two temples if the beginning is of water in two navels, or on one side if it is the beginning of water in one navel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Penetrate with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are under the skin; and let the cauteries be long in that length of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Guard against flows of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see flows of blood from him, stop them with some medicine which is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I bring wisdom, which comes from the extraction of arrows and from the cauterization of these wounds and the flow of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the head, under the bones, with two cauteries made recently.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the holes are old and persistent, and flow through veins and arteries in the head, causing a surplus of phlegmatic moisture, then cauterize it with the cautery we described in the chapter on the beginning of water gushing from the holes; apply the cautery in the middle part of the head, and use two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and two cauteries on the neck under the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for more cauterization, then cauterize it all over the root of the hole on the upper lip with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization for the odor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat a patient with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not work, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize the midline of the head with an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize the nose with a small cautery at two cauteries above the upper lip under the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn the artery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the form of the nail cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cautery for softening the eyelids of the holes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the hole is softened due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with one cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are cauterizing it above the two eyebrows, do so with two small cauteries on each side, and have them extended from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard with the cautery, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is adhere.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cautery for the eyelid of the hole when the hairs are converted to the inside parts and poke the hole.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the hole are converted inward so that they poke the hole, there are two ways to cauterize them: either by cautery or by burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, command the patient to pull his hairs so that they are straightened out, and while they are prolonged and curly; and if he pokes that, then you strengthen the hole with a bandage so that it does not get worse until the hairs grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they grow back and become curly, then place the patient's head in your lap, and carefully mark the eyelid of the hole with a tent, using a mark that is according to the shape of a dead leaf; and let the beginning of the mark be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place a damp cloth in white vinegar or in mullein tea on the hole.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then light the cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the marked area, little by little, in small spots, until the surface of the skin appears like a myrrh leaf, all appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of your work's health is that you see the eyelid of the hole already contracted and the hairs of it elevated from the puncture of the hole.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and lay him down for three days, and then place a bandage on him so that the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hairs return for any reason and the eyelid is softened, then do the cautery on it again all over as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize that so that it is elevated to its natural place and is curly, and the hairs do not poke the hole.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to pull his hairs so that they are prolonged and curly, and then let the mark be made of linen in the shape of a myrrh leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take gum mastic and live coals, one ounce. Chapter 17. Take that mixture and spread it on the cloth that was made in the shape of a myrrh leaf, and place it over the hole or both holes; then place the patient' head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And hold his finger over the medicine and press it gently so that the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for the biting is in him as if with fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you perceive that the biting has ceased, then remove the medicine and wash the hole with water; then consider if you see the eyelid already elevated as it is washed after the constriction by fire or incision, for then it is well; and if it returns to the medicine over the place where the medicine did not stick, and do not darken until your operation is healed and the hole contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place a bandage on him so that the scar of the constriction is eradicated, and then treat it with an ointment of diascordium or another until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, after your operation, that you guard against the falling of the medicine into the hole; and if the eyelid, after several days, becomes softened and for some reason the hairs poke the hole, then repeat your medicine on that place of the eyelid which is softened, and especially as you did at the beginning, and bandage it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of myrrh leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men' holes are diverse according to their size and smallness, and therefore according to that is your constriction made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not become experienced in this way to him who has studied this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the hole.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not succeed, then know that you cauterize it as follows: command the patient to hold his head in your lap, and let some attendant hold his head so that it is not moved nor shaken by his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a damp cloth in white vinegar or in mullein tea on the hole of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then light the cautery, of which this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is hollow, as it is shaped like a reed or a pen, from one end there is made the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it penetrates to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out as a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But what is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and draw out from it pus and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not open, then open it and extract the hernia.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the cautery, which should be well ignited, over him, and hold your hand a little away from the cautery near the start of the nose so that your hand does not get burned or the patient become disturbed, and then apply the cautery to the openings of the hernia and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like this for three days, and then place a poultice on that spot and surround it with a dry bandage until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply an acrid corrosive medicine to the bone so that it is exposed and scrape it according to what is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula which some at first said: enter the place of the fistula and open it up and then in that fissure pour in subtle cement of which its shape is made; And melt into that the quantity of one ounce of molten lead; and hold your hand with good retention so that the patient is not burned because the molten lead does not reach the hernia of that; and cover what you place over the hernia of the patient with linen or water, for the lead clogs the place of the fistula and heals it in a marvelous way.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about the cautery and treatment, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer snuff of the nose and reduce the fistula into the body of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautery for the fissure of the anus.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips, and mostly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So then when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not prove effective, then ignite the cautery with a small knife according to this shape that is described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity should be according to the subtlety of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that gently in those fissures so that the cautery reaches the depth of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is swelling and it then ruptures, and it becomes old, and the swelling becomes corroded and a fistula is made, and you treat that and your treatment does not prove effective, then when you ignite the cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, then place that ignited iron into the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the hot iron reaches the depth of it, and at the end of it do this once or twice; and then treat that with what we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it is healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the place and scrape away the corrupted bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery for teeth and of softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are burned, and you treat those with medicines and they do not help, then place the head of the patient in your lap, and ignite the cautery the form of which will come next here, so that you place the quanula over the tooth and insert into it the ignited cautery quickly, and hold your hand a little away so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should hold his mouth open with salt water for an hour, and then spit it out, for the burned tooth is solidified and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is by coldness, or in it is frostbitten or rotten, or does not respond to treatment with medicine, then cautery in that is according to two ways: either cautery with a cow's horn, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a horn is that you take a cow's horn and melt it in the embers of fire, and then take it with tongs and wrap it around the end of the tooth, and then dip that into the melted horn, and place that over the painful tooth quickly so that it is frostbitten.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times so that the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cotton in the horn, and place that over the painful tooth, and place ignited iron over it so that the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cautery with fire is that you wait for the iron or needle to be red-hot, and there should be some thickness in it and the acuity of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery the form of which will come, and place that over the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery is frostbitten; and do this several times because the pain will return again or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And if through the pressure of that cautery the patient fills his mouth with good saliva and holds it for an hour and then spits it out, this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize however you wish according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the needle:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .xxii.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cautery for hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are of phlegm and cold humors and do not respond to digestion with medicines and you see the digestion of those slightly, then ignite the cautery in such a way that the smoke of the cautery passes through both ends, and place that ignited over the hernia once, and if they do not respond to that, then repeat it so that it reaches the depth of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then place the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia, and let it rest for three days, and place over it poultice dipped in ointment so that what the fire has burned is softened.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the needle or iron for cautery is thus described.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter .xxiii.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cautery for earache and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture comes upon the hollow of the lung, and especially when it is with coldness of complexions, then let the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that after the root of the gullet in the place which is swollen.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And take care that you do not reach with the cautery to the gullet or burn the cords of it, but a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery after the joint of the throat in its last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery for him be a heated needle according to the previous manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with what has been mentioned before, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of cautery for lung diseases and coughs.
