Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by dampness infiltrating the body, and the patient doesn't have a fever or consumption, and the disease is old, then cauterize that with two cauteries over the furcula in the places just below the collarbones and between the nipples; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the breasts; and let the cauteries be heated according to the previous method.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cautery be pointed with the cautery that is called "punta", the form of which is described in the puncturing of ear pain.

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of cautery for the tickling in the throat.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the throat is dislocated due to damp and slippery humors, and it does not return to its proper position in the time of its recovery, and instead is displaced by a slight movement as we have witnessed, then first reduce the dislocation, and let the patient be reversed onto his back or onto his side; and then lift the chin which is at the beginning inside the tickling up towards the positions above with the fingers of your left hand if the joint is dislocated in the inner positions.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery which has two points; and this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the chin so that it penetrates into the other side; and the figure of the cautery will come then from two-pointed cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is fine according to the amount of tickling; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to that account, for which there are eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then put on the cautery some powder and let the patient adhere to tranquillity, and the limb should not be moved for any length of time until it is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is at the top and it is tight there, then cauterize the muscle with a pointed cautery or with some pointed cauteries, for the joint is confirmed and the humidity is broken up and the patient will be healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cautery of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there comes into the stomach a movement and masses of humidity which cause a swelling of its cavity, and if you continue with your methods of treatment and do not give in, then let the patient lie on his back with his head extended, and stretch out his arms and legs, and cauterize that with three cauteries: one cautery below the feet according to the length of a finger with a pointed cautery, and two cauteries below the ribs so that the figure of the cautery comes as a triangle; and let them not be too close together so that they may cause burning.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the thickness of two-thirds of a hair.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form: and that shall be a cautery according to the form of a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be punctured at that place from which this cautery is frightened: and you shall sense on the stomach according to the amount of tickling, and then cauterize that with a cautery in the points; and then cure that with the cure that has been mentioned before until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of cautery of the fried liver.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the liver from chilling or from humidity or from excessive wind which causes a swelling outside of its normal cavity, and it is cured with what has been said before and not giving in, then let the patient lie on his back on his chest, and sense the tickling with three cauteries according to this form and this amount placed upon the liver just below the hypochondria where the man lies.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the body rightwards.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press with your hand against the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of that which is burned is the thickness of the thickness of the tip of the chin, and it is not too close together; and if the patient lies on his feet; and if he is not, then let him sit, who has already stretched out his limbs, and lift up his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And you are able to cauterize these cauteries with a scalpel when you have subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware of going too far in the cauterization, and let all the thickness of the chin be burned so that it reaches into the intestines, for the chin here is thin; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of puncturing of an abscess on the liver with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an ulcer or abscess on the liver and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient will feel heavy and the pain will be acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the liver, then there is great pain and many doctors have tired themselves in their cure of him.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	And so let the patient lie on his back; and then sense the place of the abscess with tickling; and then heat the cautery which is like a rake, the form of which is preceded in the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery into the liver until all the thickness is burnt up, so that it reaches the brain, where a ulcer occurs.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that by the cure of other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this form of cautery unless that person whose study in the art of medicine is prolonged, and who has experienced many illnesses through it; but rather let that be done by us, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery of phlegmy humors.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	Dried the old cauteries of the roots of aristology for phlegmy humors according to this manner, and let that which you take from the roots of aristology be long and dry, and let it be as thick as a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and heat it over the fire, and then cauterize with one cautery that place which is between the continuation of the furcula with the collar; and with two small cauteries below the guids, one a little declining towards the part where the beard grows, and with two cauteries at what declines between the fifth rib and the breastbone, declining a little to the parts behind; and with another cautery on the middle of the chest; and with three cauteries on the parts behind; and with one cautery in that place which is between the two shoulders, and with two cauteries on the sides of the chest below; and let there be a cautery in that place where it declines between the armpit and the breastbone.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not cover your hand with the cautery, but rather in the open air as it is working.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancient writers say that they are some of the men who use cauterization with a piece of red hot iron, and apply it to that place between the ribs, until they reach the aposteme and the pus is discharged, as we have said about the aposteme in the liver.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But with this cauterization one should not be afraid, because there is a fistula in the hole to which there is no cure.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cauterization of the melsa.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you cure the sickness of the melsa with what we have said about the cure in division and do not apply your cure, then the cauterization on it is according to three ways, all of which are right, one of which is that you make three cauteries or four depending on the length of the melsa, according to the shape of the cauteries of the liver, the shape of which has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And there should be between each cautery the thickness of a finger or a little more, and the manner of the cautery is the same way we have said about the cautery of the liver equally.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not cover your hand with the cautery, and let the patient be on his back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And another way of cauterizing is that you ignite the cautery having two bandages, the cause of which we have said in the chapter about the dislocation of the muscle, and elevate the vein which is in the edge of the melsa where the patient's left side lies without.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation with which you elevate the vein be according to the length of the body, so that there are made cauteries according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two bandages, ignited hot, in that place where you penetrate the vein from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then withdraw the cautery; and thus there are made four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three bandages.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery after it has been laid for several days, because the other causes precede in the cure.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of the cauterization of hydrops.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterize not in hydrops but in an ulcer properly.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you cure hydrops with the methods of cure which we have said about division and do not apply your cure, then that cauterize it with four cauteries around the omphalus and with one cautery over the stomach, and another cautery over the liver, and another cautery over the melsa, and two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and one cautery in the right side of the foot, and another cautery over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the vein.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then withdraw the cautery open so that it bleeds for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient of cure after the cautery with what covers it so that there are added to him two tensions and he is healed by aid of the cure.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be key-like according to what its shape is above, and that with which the back is cauterized should be olive-like according to what its shape is above.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Of the cauterization of feet and thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are apostematous in hydrops and filled with yellow water, then that cauterizes the feet on the instep of the foot in the space between the auricular and the annular, and elevate your hand with the cautery and do not twist it; and then elevate your hand, and do not return it at all, because the yellow water oozes out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	It is the cautery according to this form: and then make two cauteries over the two thighs, and in each thigh there should be made cautery with the tip of the cautery knife.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And let the cautery be according to the length of the thigh: under the knee and the other under the middle part of the thigh; and over each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And withdraw the wound open without its cure for a long time so that no water oozes from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then cure it with those causes which we have said.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	Of the cauterization of the body of the belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the body of the belly is because of a stroke and humidity that weakens the vessels, then there are the digestive and retentive vessels, which are in the stomach and in the intestines, and it is cured that with the methods of cure and do not apply, and sometimes the patient suffers cauterization of the vein that appears, then cauterize that with a large cautery over his stomach according to what has preceded in the cauterization of the stomach, with the cautery of the circle and four cauteries around the omphalus subtly, and with cautery key-like subtly; and with cautery over the alcine over the great vein, or two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if you see the humidities exuding and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize that over the pentacle and over the intestines, and tightly apply two cauteries over the stomach and near the groins, for there is perfect cure of healing of which there is no mistake.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there are in nature lingering hemorrhoids or one of thick humors rubbing or of corrupted humidities, and they are cured with what we have said about division and do not apply their cure, then cauterize it with three cauteries over the pus below the small vertebra of the back and small triangular, and with cautery above the navel.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that his stomach is swelled and his food is not digested, and sometimes his face is apostematous, then cauterize it over the stomach with a large cautery according to what has preceded; and with one cautery over the liver, and another cautery over the melsa of him with cautery key-like, and withdraw the cautery open for some time, and then cure him so that he is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of the cauterization of a hernia near its incision.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you excise a hernia, then ignite the cautery which is assembled like a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert that ignited in the hernia that is incised, and finish your hand so that it comes to the cautery at the opening of the vein from which the blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do it once or twice, because if they are many, then cauterize each of them according to what we have reckoned, and then cure those with what they agree to them so that they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over the great vein, there is more healing.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of the cauterization of fistulas which are made in nature in the parts of him.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work which we have commanded in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, then let him be healed with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore when you see a fistula in nature appearing and it is old, and corrupt humidities, then what is better than it covers is that it is applied with a subtle needle, and then know the quantity of its depth with the above-mentioned needle.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then light the cautery that resembles a rod.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then place that cautery into the fistula, and according to the amount in which it enters, withdraw it.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat with the cautery as many times as is necessary in order for those corrupted humors to be burnt - one or two or three times, depending on the amount that is needed.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And be careful of burning nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes into the bladder or the intestine, then be careful about all those locations; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy location which you think cannot penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the area inside where it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the location is sealed and the matters are removed from it and remain like this for a long time, then know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matters are not removed from it, then know that they have penetrated into the flesh and become corrupted there, or that it comes from one of those causes from which a recurrence will come in its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37:
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On cauterization of warts.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in warts there is pain due to friction or due to a large windiness, and because of this the body of the patient is tormented, then know that you should cauterize those warts with a cautery needle from which you expect recurrence.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And quickly cauterize them again with a small needle, so that there will be three cauterizations, and then the warts will go away little by little in their growth.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38:
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is weakness and softening of the bladder due to friction and humidity so that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize that at the pus-like beginning of the bladder where the hairs of the pubic hair start, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side of it, and with another on its left.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the amount of the hairs; and cauterize that at the lowest pus-like part of the navel with one cautery or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let it be a cautery needle according to how it is processed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39:
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On cauterization of the hernia.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is friction and humidity in the hernia, and because of this impregnation is prohibited, and the menses are corrupted in him, and their provocation is delayed, and pain comes due to the carrying of them, then know that the location should be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, just as we have said in the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery on the lowest pus-like part of the navel, or with two cauteries, and let it be a cautery needle.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40:
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On cauterization of the dislocation of the elbow.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors are infused into the part of the elbow, and these are caused by a displacement of its place, and a sign of it is that the joint is prolonged above the other when they are compared to each other.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is blocked in which part it is bent.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore you should cauterize the patient on the part of the elbow with a circular cautery needle, because you will have sensed by touch in the circuit of the part as it is turned, and by doing so that the part falls to its proper place in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let it be the cautery of which we spoke about earlier in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three cauteries with a large olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And let the cautery be done according to the quantity of the thickness of all the tendons; and then heal that inside which is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41:
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On cauterization of the sciatic nerve.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes in the part of the elbow, and its cause is friction and humidity, and the patient is not cured by what we have said, and that it is chronic, then know that you should let the patient out humors with stinking pills or artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize that.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the way of the cautery for it is according to two ways: or cautery with burning medicines, or cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	They go according to two known ways, one of which is that you cauterize it on the part of the joint with three triangular cauteries according to this form; and make good depth with those.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be the quantity of the thickness of the finger, and if the cautery is olive-shaped or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes let the cautery be on the middle part on the head of the elbow so that there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the way of cauterization in sciatica when pain is adherent to the elbow and it is not extended within the joint.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended within the joint, then cauterize that with two cauteries on the thigh over the location to which the pain goes; and with one cautery over the shoulder four fingers away from the hairy part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery cuts it, then let the depth of the cautery be according to the quantity of the thickness of the tendon.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the pain goes so that it is extended within the place near to the fingers of the feet, then cauterize that where it goes in with a cautery for three points or four, or more if it demands of that.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the pain goes from below the neck towards the joint, then cauterize that there with a cutting cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And beware in all cauterization that you do not end with the cautery when burning nerve or large artery, and so that through this to you it is upon the patient great harm or convulsion.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And some of those cauterized on the shoulder and ended in cauterization, and a bed a fire inflamed within which the tumor was conquered the foot, and fire perforated and corrupted all of the foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	Then strong inflammation of the abdomen occurred, and then death followed.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts simultaneously cauterize each according to this way.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And some wise men said in the cauterization of the elbow that this is the way of the cautery: make it similar to a nail of iron of which its circuit is the length of a palm; and let its orifices be according to the thickness of a finger of date or less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle let there be another third; and let the space between them be the quantity of the fingers of the toes; and let those circles be bent in two parts; and let the length of them be a finger or two fingers, and make in those margins of iron decently bent in the circles; and this is the form for it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then let it be heated in the fire so that it becomes red hot and let it be placed over the part of the elbow, the patient lying on his side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	Then cauterize that with three cauteries around in one day.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And let it lie like this for three days; then cover the wound with a poultice and keep the area open for several days; then heal the wound by applying ointment until it is cured.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Al-Buqaysi : Oh sons, we have used this type of cautery sparingly due to the fear of causing harm and because few of us have been able to practice it successfully.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	May God help those who suffer from these cauteries, and may they find relief from their pain.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	May cauteries with healing medications help you to make two circles, a hole in the middle of which a key or small iron ring is placed; the length of the needle should be the size of two nuts or hazelnuts.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And the space between them should be equal to the thickness of a finger; and they should be open below and above, and they should fit together like this:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place the patient's arm over his side, and press your hand on the part of the armpit; then take a piece of wool and dip it between the two circles, and let its quality be gradually heated by the fire, and hold it for an hour, and let the patient endure the biting and squeezing—for he will feel biting as if by fire—until the biting stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then raise your hand with the instrument and wipe the armpit clean with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Let it lie like this for three days and place a poultice on it until the swelling of the bite goes down; then let him go about his business after a few days; this is the ultimate cure.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And heal it with ointment until it is cured.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain extends into the thigh or leg, make him lie in a position where he can hold water according to how it is done in the armpit.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is how you use warm water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the preparation of medications.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take a piece of alkali and non-extinguished ashes from both ends, grind them and place them in a new woolen cloth whose bottom has a small hole, according to the amount that goes into him.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Then place another woolen cloth on top of it which has been dipped in cold water, and pour over the alkali and live embers a little warm water, which covers them like a finger; then compress them with your hand with good compression, and let the water that drips from him go into the bottom cloth.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then gather all the water and pour it over the other live embers and renewed alkali, because this water becomes very strong when heated; it is used in many medical operations and cauterizations of other parts, because this operation produces fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And among the medications are some with which wide cauterizations are performed, such as teresium and honey mixed with sulfur, and embers of soap that have been ground.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Galien relates from an ancient man the operation and cure by which sciatic nerve pain is cured; he says that it does not need any other cure, and that it heals like a wound that is healed by a poultice, because the pain goes away very quickly when treated in this way.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it should be picked from a certain tree, and if it is not found, then take a fig; the wood should be ground to a powder and placed on the arm, thigh or leg where there is pain, and it should be bound.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	Let it lie for three hours or for as long as the patient can tolerate the biting.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put him in a bath and when his body is warm, expose him to the sun, for the pain will cease and he will be healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	Know that it is not advisable for anyone to use these medications with cauteries unless there is an evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	May God help you, Escorides said that when the sciatic vein is cauterized with goat's dung, it helps very much; and the cautery should be done in this way: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat's dung and inflame it with fire until it turns into charcoal; then place it on the wool and let it lie until it is cold.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Then repeat this, and do not stop doing this until the pain in the armpit goes away and the biting stops.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this way of cauterizing is called the cow cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of cauterization for pain in two places.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes back pain occurs for various reasons, such as from a blow or a wound or from excessive evacuation, and for similar reasons, from the infusion of wet and moist matter.

De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Of cauterization at the beginning of gout.

Many times this disease occurs in small children; and the sign of its beginning in children is that they get stiff in their limbs, and there is elevation and movement.

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of cauterization for gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament. Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On the cauterization of broken bones.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a break occurs in the angles and intestines in front of the aorta in the abdomen, and this is where it begins, then you should order the patient to stop eating for a day and to use mild laxatives so that the swelling goes down from his belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then follow the patient's back with your hands, and command him to hold his breath when the hole is being probed or when the aorta or intestines are appearing.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors. E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then light the cautery, of which this is its shape:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it becomes a red-hot wire.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient' s thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery on that sign with your hand holding the cautery straight, and put it there until you reach the bone of the finger within the joint; and repeat with another application if you have not achieved it in the first application to the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And carefully observe the movement of the intestine at the time of cauterization, so that you do not burn it so that the patient does not die or suffer some other great harm.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you with the cautery do not touch the bone, your operation will be useless.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And see that the cautery for children is subtle according to their size and age.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then treat the place of the cautery with ointment for three days, until the scar from the fire has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with other remedies until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should lie on his back for 40 days, until the wound and the scar are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And see that he receives nourishment according to the length of time of his healing, which is determined by how long it takes for his belly to heal, and that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when he wants to get up after 40 days, then administer a gently made sling, and have him wear it for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let him be spared from work and overindulgence in food and drink, and violent movements, for when he uses this healing regimen completely, he will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And we have described the cure for broken bones in other parts of the belly, and so at the beginning, and you should not delay, cauterize the break with a round cautery according to its size; and then cure it with what we have said, and if it is not adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some first say that a broken bone should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is probed and felt as follows:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a line is drawn perpendicular to the length of the bone above and below the break, and your hand is placed with a nail-like cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of a dislocation.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When a pain occurs in any part due to displacement or blow, and the pain persists for a long time and does not yield to any treatment with medicines, then you should cauterize it with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery of every member is according to its size and smallness, and its nature and condition, and location of the dislocation and pain in it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	So if he is healed by the first cautery, well and good; but if not, then repeat it on him, for usually from those pains there are points in a member that approaches the patient, so that you can achieve them with cautery until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The lepers some times are cauterized for great benefit by the hot cautery, and especially if the leprosy is caused by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize him, consider if the leprosy is dry and cured with what we have said in the division, and do not touch it, nor this, and beware that the corruption extends throughout his body and all its parts, then cauterize him on the head with 5 cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and the second below him, lifting up the forehead to the end of the hair; and both over the horns, and one behind, on the nape or neck; and both over the ears, on the temples.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally your hand with the cautery a little in the bone to make a small impression, and from him the scabs are displaced, so that the expiration of thick vapors is relieved from him; and cauterize on the ulcer according to its need.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has spread over the body and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize him with those cauteries which we have mentioned in the head; and cauterize on the end of the nose, and two cauteries on both sides of the ears, and two cauteries on the two shoulders, and six cauteries on the spine, and one large cautery on the spine near the chest, and one over the neck, and two over the armpits, and one over each shoulder blade, and two over the hips, and one over each knee, and two over the shins, and two over the heels, and two over the muscles, and two over all the joints of the hands and feet, and over every tendon of the hands and feet.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves which are on the instep, so that you do not burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is cauterized with one cautery on the bone of the finger, and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the throat.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that when you draw the cauteries closer, then it is more beneficial and beneficial; and know that if the patient does not have pain in the cautery, then his body is already stupified.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And the cautery should be large or small according to the parts and joints, as it is preceded by the properties of the tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the cautery with wheat flour mixed with honey and other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is paralyzed or asleep and is not healed by medicines, oils and plasters, then cauterize the paralyzed limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the thickness of the vein a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes a paralysis is cauterized which affects the hands and feet, and the vertebrae of the back, and you see the movement of the nerves which move that limb, and the paralysis is improved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume about this except for one who is skilled in anatomy of the parts and the exit of the nerves through all the body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterization for white leprosy.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When leprosy is old and does not respond to any of the ointments of medicine, then cauterize it with a cautery made from pitch according to the quantity of the thickness of the vein so that the whiteness and color of it are improved and its color changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with wheat flour and lentil flour mixed with rose oil and leaves of the arnica rose, and pigeon blood or thrush blood, let each be a part and all be mixed together, then line a cloth and place it on the spot until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On cauterization for cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around the edge of it as it is being rolled up.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of it; but I have not seen this, for I fear that it will be ulcerated and I have seen this happen a few times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more direct that it should be cauterized around the edge of it with a circular cautery as we have said, or with many cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterization for dimness of sight.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When dimness of sight is delayed in ripening, and it is because of the excess making it, or because of the state of the patient, for he is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of time, and you want to hasten the ripening of dimness of sight; then cauterize around the edge of it with many small puncturing cauteries; and then let her hasten in ripening.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to pierce it with a cautery, then heat the cautery of which this is the form of it: and place that in the middle of dimness of sight so that it penetrates the vein.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is in that place which is lower down, so that the arm of the body is raised; then treat that until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization for corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a rotting walking in the limb, which corrodes it like fire eating dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore if you see corrosion in a place which can suffer cauterization by fire, then heat small nail cauteries, and large ones according to what is appropriate in that place in which there is corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	Then cauterize that throughout its whole length so that you eradicate all the corrosion and not leave any cause of it remaining.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Then let that be for three days, and place on the cauterized spots a poultice of soft bread with mixed oil so that the scars are all eradicated and all the corrosion.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Then treat that with ointments engendering flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that the flesh is not growing and is healthy where there is no corrosion, then it is good; but if not, then repeat the cauterization on that which is rotten in the places of corruption.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is treated some times with sharp medicine because it is midway between cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But however cauterization by fire is the most dangerous course of action.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said its treatment with sharp medicine in division, and therefore take that when it has a beginning in growth.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterization of sores and of the others like them.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times sores come from beneath the foot of a sick person which is called a claw, and it is a great cause, boring into the foot; and cauterization in those sores is according to two methods, namely cauterization by fire and cauterization by water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization by fire is that you ignite the cautery made like a lead pencil, which should be made of iron according to the quantity which contains the claw throughout its whole length, and it should be of subtle thickness.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place that ignited cautery on the claw and then revolve your hand with the cautery around the edge of the claw so that the cautery reaches the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let that be for three days until it starts to emit the arm.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then poultice that with malva leaves crushed with salt, and place the poultice on it for one night, for that will eradicate from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that spot with ointment engendering flesh until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert and often affects the surface of the body, chiefly in the hands and feet, then take that you administer in those cauteries water, and it is that you insert a cannula of iron or lead or bone, and place that on the claw; and let the water enter through the entrance of the root of the claw, and wait for the sick person for an hour, and then remove that, for the claw with its roots will have been eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do the same for those the others which come over all of them in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Then treat those sores whose roots have been eradicated with that of the ointments engendering flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When trembling comes from rubbing on a nerve or from fever caused by rubbing, or from some other cause resembling it, then take that you cauterize that with four cauteries or with V-shaped cauteries between each of the vertebrae; and cauterize on the feet of him, and on his stomach with olive oil.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of him is rested and hastened by the sickness caused by rubbing.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cauterization for accidental wounds on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body so are broken blisters and there are large holes which are made from corrupt gross matter; therefore take that at the beginning as it appears, that it is cauterized on all heads of the fistula with a subtle cautery made from myrrh wood, the tip of which is extended with fire; or with long razors; or with a cautery slowly.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is cauterized with a caustic at the beginning of its emission according to this manner; and they are not broken, and the superficiality is split making those wounds heal from them.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But nevertheless it is necessary that this be done with an evacuation by phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of the cauterization of blood flow from an accidental wound by incision of the artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Troops seen thereupon flow of artery which is cut under the plague, or under the incision of abscesses or cautery of limb, and others alike, and it is difficult to heal that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when it happens to someone, then you·t cover with your hand at the opening of the artery, and place your finger inside narrow that opening so that the flow of blood is stopped under your finger, and that it does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then place on the fire the olive cauteries, few and large, by many numbers, and exhale over them so that many embers light.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take of those one small or large according to the site and the plague in which the artery is broken, over that vein quickly as you have stopped with your finger, and apply the cautery there until it is bound and stopped that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you release your finger and loosen the cautery, then take another cautery carefully from the cauteries which in the fire are prepared, and then do not cease doing that one after another until the blood is constricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you don't burn the nerve which is here, and that it come over the patient any other evil.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when from the artery flows blood, then it is not possible in those to constrict the blood, and most when the artery is large, if not by one of four ways: or by cautery as we have said, or by incision when it is not extracted, for when it is extracted the ends of it are burned and the blood is constricted, or that it be tied with a ligature or with a bandage by strong constriction, or that medicines whose virtue is to constrict the blood be applied over it; and that they be bound with a bandage with decent compression.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers a decent constriction of it with a bandage and compression with burning causes and alike does not confer anything except misery.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present nor medicine, then open with your finger on the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand to the great constriction of it until the blood is stopped from the principal part of the plague, and over the artery the finger is not released; and over the artery is sprinkled water mixed with something greatly cold until the blood is congealed and thickened; and according to what need there is for cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing and puncturing and phlebotomy and of plagues and of their alike.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the diseases in which cautery by fire is convenient and the medicines burning, and their occasions and causes, and the instruments in which necessary are the forms of the cauteries; and we have ordered the chapters from the supra-occipital region of the head until the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will proceed in this chapter in that same way, so that the reader of it may be eased in that, then about that for which he has asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before we begin that, know, son, that in this chapter is for terror that which is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because of that it is in him great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter many times there is an evacuation that which is with blood with which life is over the sprinkling of the vein or incision upon the abscess or opening of the wound or cleansing of the plague or extraction of arrow or piercing of stone and their alike.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all those are accompanied by fear and trembling and in the end of them death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you not fall that in which there is danger, for some times it happens by methods of men with many methods of diseases.
