E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them is one who dies from his disease and is the longer of his disease, and by the severity of what he finds from his disease, and from the length of his disease, and because the disease means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from those is he who gives you hope and word, you hoping in his health, and his disease is perilous.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore not think that you consent in he who comes to you of whom this manner is; and your caution be greater than confidence and your rapacity, and not presume any cause about that except certain science which verifies that over you, and to whose favor laudable succession perishes.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your diseases of prognosis and indication of he to whom is converted health, for in him is over you helper in acquisition of fame and memory, of laudation and of glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O son, God inspire your understanding and not withhold from you direction and protection, for that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters according to what precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head until the feet, so that it is eased for you that which you ask from that and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this disease many times happens to children over childbirth and when the nurse shakes the head of the infant he has lightheadedness.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some times by obscure cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this disease except in children; and to all those for whom I have seen it the death lies in wait, and by that is to me been shown action in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen an infant whose head was full of water, and the head of him was always magnified until he could not stand over his parents because of the bigness of his head, and but that the moisture was increased by fire death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture is increased between the scalp and the bone, or it is increased below the bone upon the brain.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in he if the moisture is between the scalp and the bone and the abscess is small, then know that you split in the middle place of the head with one split in the breadth, and let the length of the split be two notches so that the moisture may run; and this is the form of the spatulum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the moisture is more increased and the abscess is larger, then are here two splits according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is below the bone, sign of he is that you see the seams of the head open all over and the water is drawn out when you compress it with your hand to the splits; and this is not to you hidden.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Know that you split in the middle place of the head with three splits according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract all the moisture, and then tighten the splits with bandages and plasters, and then embed he in wax and oil on the fifth day, and then loosen the binding and cure the wound with tentas and ointments, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture so that the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	There is another method of incision that considers the size of the abscess and the collection of pus, as it may be larger in the occipital region, or in the area in front, or on the right or left side; therefore, pay attention to the incision where the abscess appears and the gathering of pus, and do this according to what is best possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery and cause a flow of blood and kill the patient through that flow of blood with the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are close to the ears, called the carotid arteries.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is a wound or ulcer on the legs or feet, and it becomes old, and the treatment with medicines does not work, then the next best course of action is to make an incision in those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then, when you want to cut the arteries that the patient raises his head, and you have wiped the area with a sharp cloth so that the arteries appear, and you have tightened the neck of the patient with some cloth; and you should look for the pulse in the vein; and these locations are above the locations that are close to the ears, and they are hidden in most people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And you should press on the artery with your finger, and cut each one with a sharp knife, coming in at an angle towards the bone, and do this around the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the knife below the artery and cut it in relation to the parts above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers wide, because when a vein is cut, the blood rushes out with a pulsating exit, which jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the neck, then you should measure from the ear the quantity of space of three fingers, and press with your finger, and go into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which flows out is a quantity of wine, one ounce. And the flow is very little or not at all, and all of this depends on the condition of the patient and the fullness of the artery in him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And you should consider the wound, and if something remains on the bone as a cause of pain, then cut it so that it does not cause an abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And you should stretch the wound with tweezers and with linen cloth, and cure it with ointment inside so that it heals.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When someone experiences ancient migration or ulcers, due to humid, hot, and painful humors in the temples, or if there is an old sore that is violent and similar to these, and it is treated with the methods of medicinal healing without success, then we have found that extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those places as I have shown, is effective.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient raises his head; and understand the artery which appears in the temple, for it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden in most people due to the intensity of the beating.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the neck of the patient should be tightened with some cloth; and you should wipe the area with a sharp cloth or moisten the place with warm water until you see the artery clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the knife, which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And you cut the skin with it easily so that you reach the artery; and you push into it deeply and extract it from the upper parts so that you pull it out of the skin and discover it from under the membranes which are under it, from every part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then you wrap it with the tip of your fingers, and cut it from that place in a way that depends on the quantity by which its extremities are extended and contracted, and there will be no flow of blood, because if they are not cut, the blood cannot flow out at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And you should draw off an ounce of blood. three to four times.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must ligate it in two places with strong, double threads of linen or with cords far apart so that there is no decay before the healing of the wound and so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And you cut off the superfluity which is between two membranes; and do this in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize it with a cautery into the bone with a cutting cautery so that its extremities are cut off, and it will remain in place instead of that operation.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do this when the patient does not have fever or is of cold complexions; because cauterization helps to drive out fine humors, and therefore it is better for youthfulness.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is fitting to extract the arteries which appear at the site of an old wound, and have powder decently made laid upon them, and then let it be cured with dry medicines causing the flesh to heal and with poultices so that it becomes healthy.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you operate there happens to be a flow of blood from the artery, then you tie that blood, or with cauterization, or by pressing on the site of the wound, and tighten your hand so that the blood is constricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes is present to you, then place your finger on the spot where the blood has coagulated, and moisten the place with warm water of strong intensity so that the keenness is relieved, and tighten according to what you can.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is more difficult in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, because you have felt the two places with your finger, and placed them, heated with fire, so that they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that it becomes elongated between its extremities, because it has not been consolidated at all by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the keenness of its two points is equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if it is more acute than two points, which is better because if they are sharp when they approach each other on both sides and do not cut into the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, if there is any thickness in them, it is held that the heat of the fire is less in those and the flesh is cut off more widely.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this operation is better in all works and more distant.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between its two points be the quantity of the thickness of a finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter IV.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure of acute and sour wounds of the gulfs.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are sour wounds, and the veins of which they are above on the forehead, and there is no cause for the cure with medicine, and the face of the patient becomes red and feels in his forehead as if it were walking with ants, and the ears of that one are exhausted, perspiring so that the hair of them is known, and the eyelids are swollen due to the keenness of tears, the old ones experienced in the cure of those by this operation, and they call that cure with the sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to raise his hair which is on his forehead, and then cut three gashes evenly distant according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the crack is two fingers wide: one crack should be evenly distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little movement of the eyelids which are in the tear duct, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful at the beginning of the arches which are on both sides, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is the amount of three fingers wide.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And to you a piece of sponge equipped or dry cloths moved with which you dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the spatula of two acute ends, of which this is the shape of its incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the part of the temples between to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Gouge out with that all the gordian which is between two incisions with the chisel which is above the bone, and then do that of the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then spread that spatula and insert into the first incision again another instrument which is called a cutlass, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the side of that sharp against the meat annexed to the gordian, and the side of it against the bone, and use that until it comes to the middle crack, and cut with that all the vessels that descend from the head to the armpits.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Let the incision be continued until it comes to the gordian, and then do that in the middle crack into the other crack.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And after the blood has run equally, squeeze out the places of the congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then put into each crack a cotton wool with old wine vinegar, and put over that powders wetted in wine and oil, and bandages so that it does not develop an ulcerous wound.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the bandage and give a great infusion of warm water or tea, and then cure that with basilicon ointment made with rosin oil and others so that the wounds may be healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the cure of warts by cauterization and from the armpits descending from the parts within the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to someone warts come and continue, and you see the armpits of the patient emaciated little, and already the guarding of them is weakened, and the eyelids ulcerated and from there hairless, and in the forehead an acute pain piercing and consequent estrangement result, then know through these accidents that the materials and warts do not come but from certain veins of the parts within proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in those is this: that you command the patient to shave his forehead, and then cut into that a crack in the middle of the forehead, a little by width (and begin with the crack of the left temple into the right temple; and let it be an incision into the bone; and lengthen your hand from the eyelids of the temples which are worn away because of chewing), so that the bone may be uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth, and then fill in between the two lips of the crack with old cotton or dry cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then tighten it above with powders wetted in wine and oil so that it does not develop an ulcerous wound.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you loosen that and see that the ulcer is already diminished, then know that it is rubbed on the bone where it begins in him naked meat, and then cure that with an exsiccative regimen which makes the meat wither, just as if you take from wheat flour two parts and of colophony four parts and mix them together, and make a plaster of it and administer it to those wounds of the meat.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure of what bites in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The whole cause that bites in the ears is one of four species, for it is either mineral stone or a cause similar to stone, like iron and glass, or it is from a plant, like chickpeas or beans, or a volatile cause, like water and wine and their likes, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when stone bites in the ear or another cause similar to those causes which do not fit into it but grow in the ear, and put the ear to the sun, and if you see the stone, then distill from that some cause of violet oil or sesame oil, and then administer its distillation, and make it sneeze with a condiment, and stop up the nostrils by reason of the sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put around the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and stretch out the ear to the sides above it, for many times it is bored through by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not bored through, then administer its distillation with the instrument called very sharp curved forceps, of which this is the shape:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is bored through with forceps, let it be; and if not, then administer its extraction with a subtle hook of little bending.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not bored through by that, then make a cannula of ram and insert the end of the cannula into the hole of the ear and close the end of the cannula with wax and with softened oil so that only the cannula be open.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract with your own wind with strong吸引力, for troops have been seen with it.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not bored through in this manner, then take alum or prepared vetches with which they are pressed the ears a little quantity, and put that into the end of ray, and then wrap around that decently paused cotton.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then draw out the ear from moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not bored through with all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut back such before it develops an ulcerous wound or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting it back is that you at first cause the blood vessels of the sephasic vein to be shaken and extracted according to the manner of its nature, and then make that to cease between your hands and turn the ear to the sides above it, and stop with a little crack in the root of the ear by reason of the grey matter in the place where you see it pressed from within.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the crack be of moon shape so that it may come to the stone, and when the stone is driven in, pull it out with appropriate instruments; and then close up the crack at that time with speed, and cure that so that it may be healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause bites in the ear is one of the fats that grow and become swollen, then administer its cure and extraction; but if it does not obey your command, then you take a very subtle spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the incision of that fat which is bitten in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put that in many pieces, and then extract those with hooks or with very subtle forceps, or by incision just as we have said, for the extraction of it is made easier.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which is entered into the ear let the patient sneeze with a condiment at the beginning, and fill his own ear with old cotton, and put that over that ear in which there is the water, and if by that it is bored through, let it be; and if not, then take thin stones and leans according to their length, and heat those in the fire a little, and let the patient insert one of those into the hole of his ear and suck with one of those on that spot and press with another stone upon that stone which is bitten in the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So do not stop this until all the water has been discharged.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been discharged, take some paper or linen and place it and put one end in the ear and extend the other end with fire until it is burnt.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put in another piece of linen and do this as many times as is necessary until all the water has been discharged, and then tie it with a string like that which was described for the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But for the extraction of an object that has entered the ear, if it is a small object, similar to a bean or pea, treat it as we have said in the previous section; but if it is a large object which is causing pressure on the brain, then administer the extraction using forceps and pincers, and the cause of this is usually a foreign object lodged in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm that has been generated in the ear, when you treat it as we have said in the previous section and in the treatise on distillations, and do not follow our instructions for your treatment, then you should look at the ear in the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if some cause of the worm appears there, then extract it using forceps or a fine pair of pincers; but if nothing appears, then take a tube that is narrow at one end and broader at the other, like this:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the narrow end into the ear according to how much pain the patient can endure; and then suck hard with it, doing this several times, until all the worms are discharged.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if he does not obey you, then stop up the end of the tube with wax as we have said; and then administer the distillations which were described by the ancients in the treatment of worms, and you will find them in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be that by which you pour the medical oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And let it be made of silver or brass; narrow at the bottom and having a small hole in it, and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then let it be fitted with a plug so that it fits into the cavity of the container where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the reed and wrap its end decently with cotton, and then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or juice from any herb, or anything you wish from these medicines, into the tube — and that is inserted in the ear —, and then put in the reed with its end wrapped, and squeeze it with your hand that which is wrapped with a templed compression around it until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been poured into the ear should already be made warm with fire a little bit.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And take care that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too hot, for the medicines of the ears cannot endure excessive heat.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear obstructions.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some children are born with a membrane blocking the ears of their mothers; and this also happens in some adults, an obstruction in the middle of the ear due to phlegm or a growth there; and this obstruction sometimes occurs in the opening of the ear-drum which does not reach the brain, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the middle part, which does not reach the brain, is in the greater dispositions of difficult cure.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which you reach the brain, let the patient's ear be exposed to the sun and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if you see any inflammation, open that with a subtle spatula of which this is the form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If its end is small, let one side be pointed and the other not; and the spatula should be of two sides like a lion's claw so that it does not injure the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the obstruction is due to a growth in the ear or in the middle part, then open that with fine pincers and cut it easily until all the growth is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the membrane of the ear, then take a fine reed and heat it with fire for just a little while, and then put that into the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have sensed inflammation with what the patient feels with ease due to the difficulty of breathing, relieve the oppression of it with ease; and take care that you do not injure the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place over the ear a bandage of linen according to the size of the opening which you have wrapped around the egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure that the wound is healed; or else take some water and dip it in vinegar and sprinkle it on it, and if you see that the ear is already swollen, then take that off and replace it with another bandage which you have wrapped around cerated oil, until the swelling is reduced; and then treat it until it is cured.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if blood flows from it, then soak sponge or bandage in warm water and place it over the ear, and use the other treatment which constricts the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure for athelis which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athelis which appear in the eyelids of some people are wet some days and dry on others.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore let you have those with thong-like instruments or pincers, and split them with a spatula at their roots, and then place over the places thus split with oil.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain comes with a flow of blood, then cauterize those with a small subtle lance.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the better cautery is when the splits and wounds return as soon as any cause from their roots is removed; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burnt up and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the cure for granulation which appears in the eyelids of people.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it occurs in the eyelids of people some cause which is likened to granulation in its strength and hardness, and because of that granulation is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture in the eyelid above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And its appearance in it is that you should consider if the granulation proceeds from something which appears in the eyelid and is swollen on all sides; and the cause of it is diverse.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore open that with a slit according to its width, and then scrape it from all sides with ease until it discharges, and then stop that up with pincers and cut off those roots.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for its incision if it does not penetrate the eyelid with a little incision, then that will not be noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you should stitch it up; and treat it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not do harm to it unless its roots are restored and the flesh grows over it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the granulation is declining at the edges of the eyelid, then cut away its surface and stop it up with pincers; and if you make an incision there, that will not be noticed in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, wash the wound with salted water; and heal the wound with oil until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure of a ulcer in the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Ulcers are grey in colour and are usually found on the eyelids above, and mainly affect infants. They harm the eyes of those affected, and they cannot bear the brightness of the sun because of this; therefore tears flow from their eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this you will see these people always looking down at the ground, and sleeping with their mouths open; and there is swelling and redness in their eyelids, and when you press on the eyelid, you can feel a lump underneath.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And a certain type of poultice is applied to the patient who rests his head on your lap; and you prepare a cloth and make it warm, and make a circle according to the size that fits the whole ulceration, and you place this over the ulcer and press with your fingers all around so that the pus collects under the poultice.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the primary stage, you must split the skin completely so that you reach the pus, for ulcers develop in this way through a fissure according to the shape of a white swelling.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract this with cloths which you have wrapped between your fingers at the edges, and rub between the right and left hands until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to touch the ulcer with your fingers so that you do not hurt the patient while extracting it with the spatula.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if pus does not appear at the beginning of the fissure, then touch it gently with a spatula so that pus comes out; and then extract it as we have said before; and then moisten cloths in water and vinegar, and place them over the ulcer and bind those with bandages.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And also apply salt to the wound and place it in the cavity of the fissure so that any remaining humidity is absorbed.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the ulcer until it is cured.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if a scab forms on the wound, then heal it with soft poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of ways of feeling the ulcer.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of the eyes are affected by something which is placed under them and are old, then these cause pain in the eye and make conditions of illness appear as constant tears and softening of the eyelids and tissue until it becomes a cause of destruction of the eye, which is called tactinir of the eye, and it is healed in four ways: either by cauterisation with fire; or with an acute medicine as mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery; or tactinir is caused by incision and suture; or with cannulas, as I will say.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so place the patient's head in your lap; and lift up the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is lifted, that is good; but if not, insert a needle into where the pus is underneath the eyelid, and push the needle upwards towards the eyebrow, and let it be close to the margin of the eyelid where the hairs are — close to the hairs — and pull the needle upwards towards the eyebrow, and convert the eyelid towards the side.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then pierce the inner part of the eyelid where the hairs are placed with a spatula which is inserted into the tear duct from above; and then extract the pus and place tiny pieces of cotton or cloth underneath the eyelid, and then sign on the eyelid with a tent, and let it be like the shape of a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But indeed let the shape be according to the amount of swelling of the eyelid, for this varies among people; for some require a large amount to be inserted into the eyelid according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then pierce with the spatula over the two lines which you have marked, and start from the tear duct which goes from the larger to the smaller tear duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is close to the natural hairs as it is the thickness of the king's finger.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then insert the needle into one of the two corners of the ulcer, and then remove all the scabs, and then use sutures with gum or fine wool to attach the two lips together, and wipe away the blood, and let what overflows from the hairs be adhered onto the two eyebrows by some cause, if you wish to do so; but if not, do not heal it.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then let the suture of the hairs be for three or four days, and then heal it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, remove the bandage after the suturing, and heal the ulcer with something which dries it out and constricts it, for the eyelid is raised by the sealing of the bandage and the gathering of pus; but suturing is better. And so I have said the ways of tactinir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But indeed let there be diligence on the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another way in tactinir, and it is that you mark on the eyelid like a myrtle leaf, and then lift the eyelid with three curved hooks gathered together according to this shape:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible to do this, and the eye is not swollen, then take a needle in which there is thread and place it in the middle of the figure, and insert the other hook close to the tear duct from above, and use your fingers to gather the hairs evenly, and then with these lift up your hand with an even elevation, and lift up all the ulcer over which you have marked as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the two lips of the wound with sutures, and heal it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if a scab forms after your incision or fissure, then heal that scab with ointment and something similar to it, and with unguent.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the hairs of the eyelid are converted towards it; therefore use in that what we have said about incision; but suturing is more natural.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Tactinir with cannulas is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you lift up the eyelid and split the figure which is inside according to what has been described; and then with skill make two cannulas or two thin rods of which their length is according to the length of the eyelid and their width is less than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already split at the ends of some parts where you hold the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And then gather each one with subtlety under what overflows from the eyelid of the eye, and tighten the cannulas at some parts with strong pressure, and let it be for several days, for the eyelid by the pressure will die and become black and drop out so that a new one comes in its place.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then break the scab with tweezers, and then heal the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	And so when it is solidified, the eyelid is raised and the hairs do not pierce.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the way of two cannulas which you make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of elevation of warts on the face use the needle when the wart is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When they are non-natural, hard and rough warts on the face, then the operation is that you take a fine needle and place it in that vein of the cedar very gently, and then that you tie off its ends very gently.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be as much as one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you put another fine thread beneath it quickly, and tie off its ends if you wish to.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then let the patient hold his head in your hand, and be in the sun so that your work is revealed, because it is a subtle operation and delicate.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the hair which has need of skill, and make it penetrate the eyelid hurriedly while you pull upwards that which is above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair up and out, and insert it into the ointment, and let there be one or two or three hairs, but not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away so that the hair is plucked out with the ointment on the eyelid by the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled out with the ointment and not the hair, pull the ointment to the sides beneath by the thread which you have applied to it, so that in being pulled ointment comes out from above.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And you will see it on the face, because then you will pull out ointment and thread, and each and every one will close up and heal the face, and leave the slits for two or three days so that the hair can adhere to its place and grow back good flesh there.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if it is shorter, then you take a long hair from the natural hairs and elevate it with that, or you put in something to lengthen it, and then you elevate it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .xiii.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure for a wart that comes on the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When it comes on the eyelid and is caused by contraction of the eyelid when it is drawn up to either side, from bad setting or division or cauterization, and is called leporina, and this wart is either natural or accidental, and is caused by setting of plasma or divisions or cauterization, or similar to them badly cured.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The way of the operation on it is that you split that setting and separate its lips, and put in between them a thread of linen cloth, and tie those so that they may be healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not believe that you cure it of the causes which dry it out and cause constriction; because if you do that it will return worse than ever before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use on it of causes that soften like fenugreek, and broths in which are cooked aniseed and fennel seed, or ointment of diaquilon, which is liquefied with some of the oils, and immerse in it the thread, and cure with it.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the secret of your cure is that you pierce with all skill which is not consolidated according to its shape at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said, is nothing but a rectification of ehalixacrati which does not return the shape of the place according to what it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .xiiii.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure for a wart that comes on the eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This alxacrati which is made on the eyelid below, and is properly named alxacrati; and it is either natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental is caused by plasma or division or cauterization, or similar.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of operating on it is that you take a needle which has a double thread, and put that in the flesh, and let it pass from the tear duct on the left into the tear duct on the right, so that the thread comes out at both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then extend the flesh to either side with the needle and push it in with the needle, and stitch it up with wide stitches.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if it returns the shape of the eyelid according to how it was before, that is good; and if not, take a needle and put it in the split figure, and with that convert the eyelid, and split both slits on the sides of the eyelid below.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of both slits be two angles of the incision, which you have made so that they meet, and let an angle be made between them when they meet.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letter: the line.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then stitch up that flesh by the amount which is the side of it below of it, that which draws up the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then stitch up the separated parts and sew them with thread of wool; and then cure those with what we have said of the softening medicines and of the ointments so that it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if alxacrati comes from division or cauterization, then you must split with a flat split over the hairs of the eyelid as it was before.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the blade between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the summary of the speech of the cure for alxacrati when it is above or below, that it runs through operation, according to how it is prepared in the shape of alxacrati, and it is in the shape of many different shapes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans always prepare skill in every way which is possible for it so that it returns the figure to the natural shape, or near to it, and that ill person according to how it convices him of the operation and of the instruments in the best dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .xv.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this setting happens to many people in which the eyelid is more set above than the eyeball, and is prohibited from the facility of movement and of its natural works, then you insert the outer edge below the eyelid, and elevate it up there, or extend it with the finger.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you insert the adhesion with thin blade, which is not sharp at the edges, hold it bluntly so that the ill person is not troubled after operation, and keep the blade so that it does not scratch the eye with its edge.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision split that adhesion with facility so that the eyelid is returned according to its natural shape, and all the adhesion be healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you put in the eye salted water with which you wash it, or distil in it of zunia dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eyeball with blade of li, and put over the eyeball wool infused in white of egg, and on third day use causes of consolidation so that it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter .xvi.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of nail and of prominence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that ungla is according to two ways, because it is nervous, and is like hard ciphac, thin and subtle; or it is non-nervous, like white hardness congealed, which when the iron touches it, or it is forced in it, it takes on a color, or it is abscinded and the iron is not placed in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both the kinds do not begin unless from the tear duct which goes little by little that covers the sight and prohibits light and movement of eyeball.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	The manner of operating at the eye is that the patient places his head in your lap, and you open his eyelids, and elevate the eyelid with your hand, and you gather up the eyelash with forceps after making several incisions and extend it upwards.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	Then take a needle and insert into it a horsehair or ox hair or similar, or a strong piece of gut, doubling over the end of the needle slightly and pushing it through the lash, and ligate the lash with gut; then extend it upwards, and scrape away at the side of the lash which is obscuring the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And so you follow this up with the hair into the back of the eye.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you incision the rest of the membrane in the root of the tear duct with a fine spatula or small forceps, and cut away the flesh of the natural tear duct so that through this incision there will be no continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the lash is just extended with forceps or gut as we have said, and then it is scraped away with a lion’s spatula; this is its form.
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And sometimes it is doubled over with gut alone, and sometimes with forceps; a lion’s spatula does this, and if you cannot ligate the lash with gut, make the ligature of the lash with strong gut; and sometimes it is ligated with gut alone. And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the cornea and that there be no rupture in it, and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then after the incision, throw into the eye a little salt or a medicine made of vinegar and let it remain for another day; then wash out that medicine with water so that it may heal.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the lash is not nervous and you cannot put in the needle, or it is not pierced with the forceps, then this type of lash is cured with medicines, and it is healed like this when the eye is divided.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incision it, then open up the eyelid of the patient and take a fine lion’s spatula with its point sharpened according to this form:
am subtilitat.	And draw the spatula towards the root of the tear duct by which the flow of tears is drawn; and sometimes it is cut with the spatula and sometimes it is cut with forceps.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you find that it is rarefied and drawn into the root, then distill from your eye medicine made of vinegar or red wine or salt mixed with water, and cover up the eyelid for another day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation until everything is healed, otherwise a wound cautery will be in the eyelid; therefore you open it up and cure the wound from its beginning until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation over that with reason until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The membrane of the tear duct, if it is seen in the eye from great injury, is to be suspended with forceps; and you incision that one part, and do not finish the incision so that there is no flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then distill into the tear duct red wine and vinegar until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of the operation of the other at the root of the tear duct.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyelids of algus there is born red flesh and it is raised up so that it covers the pupil, or it approaches or presses upon the eyelids, and strongly compresses the eyelids to the outer edges and it is attached as though to a stone ball.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.
