But the operation on it is that the patient places his head in your lap and you open up its eyelids and gather up all that flesh with convenient forceps for that purpose, and you hold onto that with a forcep or basket; then you incision the flesh at its beginning so that all is finished with the incision instrument, and be careful of the eye that you do not injure it after your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And it is your incision with which you incision those or with the spatula which we have recommended in the incision of the lash, or with small forceps with which the lash is gathered according to how it comes; consult that chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	So when your incision is completed and all that flesh is healed up, then fill the eye with salt mixed with water or red powder and similar things from the corrosive medicines; place over it a cloth which has been soaked in warm vinegar until it is certain there will be no wound cautery.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if for some cause of algus there is blood cautery and you fear wound cautery, then open up the eye and cure that wound cautery with medicine which yields to that wound cautery; and repeat your operation on it until it is healed; similarly do with the flesh which has occurred in the eye of this type.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio. E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the gall and place in the nose the abstraction of blood a wooden plug , and do this for three days or more so that the fluid corrodes all that is from the meats.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, place in the nose a lead pipe for several days so that he is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you see that there is no improvement, use that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to clean out the nose with which oils and medicines are distilled in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this from silver or wood, which is like a small open lamp, also with a small cone, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed tube like a cane, and the end of the instrument to clean out the nose and let it be flat, uncovered; to which you apply at his back, with which you have that when you heat in him oil or that which you want from the sucking and from the causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these are the expensive capipurges: you receive from beaver fat, white tallow, ginger, long pepper, saffron, black pepper, spikenard, and henna. You mix it with the juice of sorrel and kale, and let there be pills made from it, and let a pill be mixed with water tebezia, and let it be applied to the nostrils of the patient lying on his back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the eels in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it is seen that there is a growth of an eel in the ends of the nose, and it swells and increases over several days so that it receives its guardant.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this you must insert it into his coming of his appearance, and remove all of that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place over the area a cautery or burning medicine that is in the location of him.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its abscission is delayed so that it swells, consider then if it is hard, dusky in color and of little feeling, do not touch that with iron because there is an ulcerous boil; for many times this happens to one who inserts that.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the boil is leonine and not dusky in color, and there is an abscission possible in all of it, then you must withdraw the patient and insert that without fear, and heal the area with something that comes out of it and constrict it so that he is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suturing of the nose, and of the lips, and of the ears when the continuity is dissolved by plague or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is a dissolution of continuity in one of these cartilages, there is little to be done in that operation except in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when for some cause or other, you find that it is a fresh plague with its blood, then you should bring together the two lips of the plague with a suture, and then cure that inside so that it may heal.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the dissolution of continuity are already separated, and each is made healthy, then you should cut off each part of its cord until that it bleeds.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then join the two lips with a suture and strengthen those, and over that pulverize dragon's blood and finely ground herbs, and place over the powder a piece of a diafinicon plaster or one of the other consolidative plasters, and leave it there for two or three days, and then remove that plaster and change the plaster and let it stay there so that the wound may heal by itself, and then cure with ointment until it is healthy.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of the suture is that you make the dissolution of continuity either with needles as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or make the dissolution of continuity with a thread as we have said before and let us know.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips on the inside of the parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times, in many men in the inside of their lips there are certain hard pustules that resemble err-grass, and some of them are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore you should turn the lips inside out and cut each of those hardnesses from all sides, and then close up the incision with finely ground sage so that the blood is constricted, and then wash it with wine vinegar and cure the area with something astringent until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh joined to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Frequently there is on the gum a piece of flesh which the ancients called albuginea, and so when you suspend that with an instrument or with your fingers and cut it away from its root, let the pus run out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then place over the area finely ground sage or other astringent or cauterizing powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it away again secondarily, and cauterize it, for the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of removal of teeth with a file.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the inside of the parts and of the foramen and between the gums are attached rough, sharp scales, and sometimes they are blackened and are made yellow or green, and corrupt the gum and make the teeth loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And so you should make a cut between your fingers and place the head of it in your mouth, and rub the teeth where those scales appear and the causes like sand until no cause remains from them, and that makes the blackness and the yellowing and the others go away so that they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	And if that is what is at the beginning of the root, then it is good; and if not, then you should do the cutting over those again on the second or third day until it comes to the final state in whatever you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many different types and figures of tools according to how your operation is prepared.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore the file with which the tooth is filed from the inside of the part is another type of file than that with which it is filed between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of files you should prepare them as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You should cure the tooth of its pain with every trick and delay in completely extracting it, for there is no cause that exceeds the usual one when it is extracted, for it is a sublime substance that causes an excuse in its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the tooth is forced to be extracted, you should certainly be certain which is the painful tooth, for many times the pain deceives the patient and seems to be in a healthy tooth, and then you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the painful tooth is extracted, for we have seen this through the operation of the barbarians.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you are certain which is the painful tooth and know it, then you should scarify in the circuit of the tooth with a spatulum on which there is some virtue so that it is dissolved from the tooth into the gum from all sides, and then draw it with tweezers or with subtle forceps bit by bit until you extract it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then press it strongly with great forceps for good speech or strong grip, and place the head of the patient between your thighs so that he does not move, and then draw the tooth according to rectitude in a way that you do not break it or give the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and place it below it from all sides with ease and force the extraction of it just as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or rotten, then you should fill that crack with cloth and tighten it with the end of a fine wire so that it is not broken at the time of your constriction on it with forceps.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should open sufficiently with scarification in the circuit of all parts of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not break it and let the wound come apart from it, and return to the patient because of the malice so that his first pain is less.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their haste and audacity about the extraction of them, for they do not administer what we have recommended; for many times they bring great illnesses on men which are difficult to extract, and their roots are all wrinkled, or some of them, or that you draw it with some bones from the jaw just as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the extraction of it should be washed in the mouth with wine vinegar or wine with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if it flows with blood afterwards, then grind some amount of alum and sprinkled over the wound, and if that alum does not work, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and tweezers with which the tooth is drawn at the beginning should be of long length, short handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let them also be of thick handle within so that when you stretch them with those they are not bent, let them be short lengths.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of iron of India drawn to a point with straight edges, and in the edges of those there are teeth of which some enter into others and stretch by strong constriction, and sometimes the edges of those are the shape of a goose beak which is hooked, it is bent, and they are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of extraction of teeth and of drawing the bones from the jaws that are bitten.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth that is broken for some reason, then you should put over the affected area a poultice for one or two days until the area becomes soft; and then insert tweezers or tongs whose ends are shaped like the beak of a bird called stork or pliers, the shape of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of them should be made inside as if they were a file or an axe.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey me in this use of forceps or tongs, then you should cut through the gum and uncover all the flesh and insert the tool that is called "crown", it's a small lever whose shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let its tip be broad and not pointed so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Thus if through this the gum is torn away, it is good; and if not, use these other tools of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first tool is triangular at its end in which there should be some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second tool is that it has a triangular and very thin end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you will be helped by this tool having two prongs, of which this is the shape, namely the following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and other instruments which are used in tooth extraction; for this is done with this tool which is like a large hook, and this is its shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular end bent or short, which should have some thickness, and not be pointed so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing is that the instruments for moving teeth are similar to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and skillful practitioner in this art finds for himself many methods according to the operations and various diseases; for there are diseases of which the ancients did not speak nor prescribe any proper instruments, because of the forms of the different species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones in the mouth is broken, or if it is dislocated, then there should be applied to it at its place a weight convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of tooth roots, and use the tool whose form is as follows:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness put on it little by little, and let it be bound or held with the mouth so that it does not evade or flee until the bone is completely soft; then restore the place with appropriate medicines for this purpose.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a slight dislocation in the bone, then cut away that dislocation and its blackness, and cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of teeth that are prominent above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent not according to their natural form, and especially when this is the case for women, and especially for old women; then you must consider: if a tooth is next to another tooth, and it is not possible to cut it or file it, then pull that tooth out; but if it is not next to another tooth, then you insert that tooth with this tool whose form is as follows; it is like a pig's snout, and should be made of Indian iron with a pointed end.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And you must insert it in such a way that the tooth is inserted into it in two or three days because of the hardness of the tooth, and that no other teeth are affected.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth exposed to filing, then file that tooth with an Indian-iron file whose form is as follows:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it all be of Indian iron, and its edge sharp; and let it have fine points as with the file with which needles are made, and with which the tooth is filed little by little in several days with ease, so that no other teeth are affected or cut.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then smooth it out at its end, and cut away any blackness with a razor blade.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a tooth whose side is broken and which hurts the tongue, then you must file it so that the edge of that fracture is blunted and smoothed, and flattened so that the tongue is not hurt nor speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of restoring broken teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth have received concussion and loosening through a blow or through falling, and the patient cannot chew on that side, and you have cured it with astringent medicines, and your cure has not been effective, then so that they do not loosen, there should be inserted in them gold wire and not silver wire, for silver will bend and after a few days will dislodge, but gold will remain firm.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the wire be of such thinness and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the binding is that you take the wire and pass it between two healthy teeth, and then let it grow with two curves of the wire between two broken ones, or if one or more, so that the thread comes to the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then tighten the binding at the end from which you began, and strengthen your work with ease and skill so that it is not broken.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your binding be such that by which you bind the wire so that it does not come out.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then insert the ends of the wire with forceps or tongs, and apply them in each place with tools, and fold them and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the broken one, so that they do not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then let it be bound as tightly as possible.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, then tighten it or those with another wire in the same way all the time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the binding of two healthy teeth and two broken ones, bound thus as follows:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when you cause one tooth or two to return by their fall to their places, and they are grown back as we have recommended, and are broken again:
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Then let not this be done except by wise practitioners.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is fitting because of some cause of the bones of cows, and it is made like a tooth in shape, and is placed in its place where the tooth failed, and is bound as we have said, and remains and serves with him for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the cutting of the thread that comes in the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This thread which appears under the tongue some times by nature or accidentally and occurs through a wound that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in it is that you open the patient's mouth, and lay his jaw bone aside; and lift up his tongue, and then insert that nerve thread according to its width so that the tongue is loosened from its binding.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if in it there is any hardness or knotting, and this exists because of a healing from a wound, then you cut it with a sharp instrument and split that according to its width so that you have cut the thread and the knotting is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware lest there be made a crack in the bone flesh, and you split up here the hard part of the bone and blood flows out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then let it be washed with the dregs of wine or with vinegar, or with water in which there has been ground pepper; and then keep the tongue pressed down with a cloth, so that the patient does not speak again until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if there is bleeding, place powdered vitriol on the spot; but if blood comes out, then cauterize the spot with a lanolin cautery that is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes an abscess forms under the tongue, resembling a small lump, which hinders the tongue from performing its natural functions, and it grows larger as it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is to open the patient's mouth facing the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it is dark colored or black, hard, and the patient feels no pain when you touch it, then do not touch that spot because it is a ulcerous sore.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined towards whiteness, and moist, then you should put the needle into it, and pierce it all around; and if blood comes out in the process of your operation, then you must place powdered vitriol on it to stop the bleeding.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have finished it, and wash the wound with sharp wine and salt; and treat that wound with other remedies for this purpose until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of an abscess from the ear, and of that which occurs in the gutter, and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the ear canal due to an obstruction of blood in the hollow of the temple; and if blood does not come out from it, then you should appeal to Podragua and pierce it with a cautery of powdered vitriol.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	But if it is of a reddish color and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron due to the flow of blood; before it has ripened, either you will draw it out or it will rupture on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, soft, and the root is thin, then that should be pierced.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is to examine, before your operation, whether the abscess has rested completely or has diminished at all; and then make the patient face the sun, with his head turned towards you, open his mouth, and the servant press the tongue down with his fingers as shown in this figure:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or bronze, and be thin with a pointy tip.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then, when you press the tongue with that instrument and see the abscess before you, place your finger on it and pierce it with the needle, drawing it outwards as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another method is to pierce one of the membrane layers; and then cut that with an instrument as shown in this figure:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is like forceps, except that its ends are curved, so that the openings of each pair are facing each other, very sharp, and should be made of iron tempered in vinegar.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then pierce it with a needle as shown in this figure: The needle should be sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And when you have pierced one spot, pierce the other according to this method, and then the patient should rinse their mouth with warm water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood comes out, then rinse with water infused with the peel of a pomegranate or a bay leaf, or with something similar to what is used for stiptiqua wounds, so that the flow of blood is stopped; and then treat that wound until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes other abscesses occur in the ear canal besides those of the ears, and they are examined as mentioned in the examination of two spots equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have treated a woman with an abscess that occurred in her ear canal; the abscess was of a dark color and there was little pain, and it had closed her ear canal, and the woman could only breathe with difficulty, and she had prohibited herself from eating and drinking water, and she was nearing death if she did not drink water for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had swollen so much that it had formed two bumps for two months before they discharged.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I treated her thoroughly and placed one of my needles in one of the bumps, and drew it out, and when I pulled it, a large portion came out; and then I examined that spot where I understood the other bump to be, and then I opened her mouth, pressed her tongue, and then I placed the needle in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut out a large piece from it, and there was only a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	So that woman's ear canal was completely closed, and she began to drink water immediately, and then she ate food; therefore I did not cease piercing that abscess many times for a long time, and the abscess occurred in the same spot where it had been prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	And then I made an incision and cauterized the vein of him, therefore until now; and then I walked around and did not know what God had done to me at that moment.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Here is the next sentence:
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the beginning of the ulcer when it is puffed up.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is catarrh in the ulcer, and it is puffed up and long, then it is called a furuncle; and if it is thick and round at the beginning, then it is called a boil.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But if it is healed by the water that we have said in the division, and does not agree with your treatment, and you see that the pustule is closed up from it and is subtle, then cover over that which is rounded off; and if it is of that length, and is bloody, of a dusky color or black, and there is no sensation to it, then cover over its incision, for in that is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, then make the patient fast and press his tongue with an instrument with which process its form, and fix the needle in the new one, and draw that one down and incision that with one of two instruments, whichever is said in the incision of two melons.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And cover over that one unless it is adjusted on the natural term without addition, for if you incision more of it, you will cut his speaking.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And on the incision, use what we have recommended in the incision of two melons, and heal that within until it is well.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is terrified by the incision of it, use in having in the cauterization of it without fear, and the manner of the cautery in it is only with acute water, and it is that you place the head of the patient in your hand, and press his tongue with the instrument which we have said, and draw from the water which we have said in the chapter on cauterization, and apply with that cause while alive, and pause that not thick nor subtle, and of that fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of it be concavity in which is placed the medicine as well as the concavity of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine over the ulcer; and let the patient jaw over his side so that flow saliva or mucilage of the mouth of that one through the intriscus medicine, so that descend from that any cause upon the vein of it and that it leads that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And on your hand with the medicine, and squeeze that over the uvula through the space of about an hour until you see that be blackened and subdued by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a thread and wrap that around the extremity of the vein, and submerge the thread in the medicine, and insert the vein with the thread into a tube of above until the thread adheres in that tube, and do that as many times until you accomplish what you want of the cauterization of the ulcer, and then let it be because it will dry up and fall off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the medicine needs to be repeated, repeat that, and after the cauterization, wash off in the circuit of the ulcer with a thread dipped in beer, and cleanse with that which is in the circuit of it from the medicine, and let it be washed with water rubbed, and be cured outside with embrocation, and inside with ointments until it is well.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this species of treatment is more safe than incision and more long of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is healed by what is more subtle than cautery and incision, for it is healed by sub-smoking in this manner: take calamus, hyssop, origanum, ruda, scichos arabic, camomile, borage and resembling those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes, or some of them, in a wave, and let them be submerged with wine vinegar, and boil; and let the wave be well-luted with decent wax, and let there be in the middle part of the wave a tunnel, on which is paused an instrument made of silver or of iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the extremity be inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the steam may rise to the uvula over the pharynx, until the uvula is very obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And on that repeat many times until it is dry, and beware so that you do not make this treatment at the beginning of the aliment of pustules, for it would press too much on the pustule, and it is not good that you do that, but wait for the declaration of the pustule to be cauterized.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if that instrument is not present to you, then take a reed and attach on the extremity of it a hollow of horn, so that the mouth of the patient be scorched, for the hollow of the horn prohibits the steam from scorching the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Here is the next sentence:
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the vein and of the other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times adheres in the vein or thorn of a foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then cover what of those is apparent, on which falls the sight, more than you press the tongue with instrument in front of the eye, so that to you be declared what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is not apparent and is hidden in the vein, then make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for strongly the annexed cause draws the vein out through vomiting; or let the patient swallow a piece of bread or a piece of lettuce or a bone of dry bread; or take a piece of sponge marine rock, and rub that firmly with gall, and then the patient swallows that, for it passes to the place in which are thorns and is extracted.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And more take an eel and be with gall bound, and let it be inside mouth and sopped out be extracted; or take a pig and sop out the inside and sop out the outside in it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not extracted with those causes which we have said, then use of an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thicker than a little needle, and in the extremity of it be concavity which you insert into his throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him lift his head up, and beware of the touching of his bones of the throat, so that it enters to him vein or the thorn, or that the doctor with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But however, that the patient who inserts it is better, by his knowledge of the place of the annexed cause and presses down below, and draws his hand up with the instrument on him, all that according to the quantity which is prepared in him until it is extracted.
Capitol .xxxix.	Here is the next sentence:
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of extraction of blood-sucking annexed to the vein.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When it is bled with what we have said in the division of the treatment with medicines and does not agree, then consider in the vein of the patient on the forehead, for you will have compressed the tongue of him with the instrument which we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you see the blood-sucking, extract that with a small needle or with thin threads decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it, then take a hollow cane and insert it into the anus of the patient, and place in the cavity of the cane a hot iron, and do this as many times (while the blood flows out and is stopped from the anus) and abstain from giving the patient water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a cloth full of water and work the mouth with it, and wash the mouth with it; and do not let him swallow any of it for any reason, and wipe his mouth with your hand from time to time as the blood flows out when he feels the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not removed with what we have described, then smoke the anus with cumin or assafetida using the instrument which we have described in the suffumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that he may pass it.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operating on it in the suffumigation, which is that you take an egg in which are hot coals and the egg be covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and the end of the instrument be fitted into that hole; and then let the suffumigation go through, and place the anus over the end of the cane, and close his mouth so that the suffumigation is not lost until you know that the suffumigation has reached the blood, for the blood will soon flow out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not come out, then repeat the suffumigation many times, and abstain from drinking, and eat salty food and garlic, and do not drink water, and by this method it must be driven out.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument by which blood is extracted from the anus when it is seen; and it is similar to tongs except that there is some curvature in it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the anus and its end is like the beak of a stork, which is broad, in which there is a hole, because, when we press for any reason, it does not slip out.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the speech in the opening of sores and their cutting.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The sores are many species, of many manners, according to which I remember them, each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their piercing and cutting by two manners, of which one is by the species of sores in themselves; and by that we take from moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is according to the places in which they occur, for the sore that occurs on the head is different from that which occurs on the buttocks; and the sore that occurs on a fleshy place is different from that which occurs on a joint; and each one of them has its play by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some sores which only need to be成熟了sania in those or filling of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other sores which need to be cut when they are crossed, and not mature according to their filling, such as sores that are near joints, for when a sore occurs near a joint, its nature is prolonged while it presses what is in the circuit of it, and strengthens the ligaments or nerves of that joint, so that there is a cause of contraction of that member; or it is near a principal member, and if you delay its piercing until it has become mature it injures the principal member; or it is near the buttocks, then pierce it before it matures; and do not cut it cruelly, because of incomplete digestion, but cut it near the buttocks so that it does not burst the part within the buttocks and is elongated to the parts inside the buttocks, and a fistula is formed, or it occurs in the end of it that it is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you should know the time of the piercing of the sore, and this is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it has matured when there is a decrease in the pain and the cessation of fever, and also the decrease in heat and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the sore, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you should know that the piercing happens in the place closest to the bottom of the sore and from pus coming from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the piercing should always be through the length of the flesh or body, if the sores are in the parts of the hands or feet, and in the places of the tendons of the nerves, and the strings; and at last, in all equal places where there is no reflection; for in those where it is reflected, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the sore is on a fleshy place, then it is better that you pierce it before the digestion of it is confirmed according to its filling, as we have said; for if you pierce it before this, the part within it is prolonged and great dirt, and the lips of it are hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some sores are pierced according to the breadth of the flesh or body, depending on the necessity, or according to that by which the member suffers.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small piercing in small sores, and in large sores a great piercing and a wide one or many piercings according to the diversity of the size of the sores.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are some sores in which the vein is hollowed out and has been cut, when it has been done so that bread and made is in a term that it already is, as well as that which occurs in pimples and blisters.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are some that are cut with three angles; and there is one in which it is cut like the shape of a bay leaf of myrtle, as well as the sores of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are some in which round cutting and lunar cutting is administered, and they are like those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one to which there is no head as are superficial sores, you should pierce that with superficial piercing, or flat only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the sore is large and has collected a lot of sanies, pierce it and do not be afraid to extract all of its pus in that hour; take out some part from it, and then close the sore for another day, and then take out a larger part, and do this many times according to graduation until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold nature, or female, or child, or old in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is often resolved by the exit of sanies, and often the patient dies, so you operate them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	But keep this chapter with great caution, and then your piercing when you pierce these sores, cleanse the plagues and consider therefore if the plague of the sore is little, or it is a flat section, then you administer oil of lye or old wine; and if the sore is large and the fissures of the piercing are many, then you should stop wax in each hole so that it comes to points.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the sore a part of the vein is cut or hollowed out around it, then you should complete it with old wine or linen thread made of linen, as well as when you have drawn out pans or roots, because of its moisture; and strengthen that within the third day; and then process it and heal it by what means, so that it comes to points.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs in the hour of your operation, then you should administer warm water and wine mixed with linen, and place that over the place of the bleeding many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood continues, then you should administer remedies and treatments, and apply powders as I have recommended in many places in this book and in its divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter time, and the location of the ulcer is in a place with many nerves, then you should mix powders with wine and hot oil, and apply those to the areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are fleshy, then you should apply powders mixed with water and oil or wine and oil, and keep that applied for three days as we have said, and then you should open the ulcer and clean it and administer to it what is suitable for its healing.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the cure for ulcers generally, but according to the method of distinction I have already said something about every type of ulcer in a particular way.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section on ulcers that come in the skin of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the skin of the head there are small ulcers that contain small nodes made of tissues that belong to them ; and their tissues are made of many things.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them there are bumps, and from those are contained moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those are the ones that contain moisture like powder, and they look alike  and from those are the ones that are hard and lapidea-like.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, even if you must extract them it will not cause an artery to be cut.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you probe those with an instrument the form of which you will see below, so long as you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained is moisture, then you should cut that according to its length through a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And you should begin the section from line .B. to line .G. Therefore when the moisture is evacuated, then you should scrape that area where that moisture was contained, and you shouldn't leave any cause of all of it there, for if any remains return, they will be caused by something else.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then you should immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment if available, and if not, then in water and salt  and fill that up with that, and leave it for another day, for by doing that you will soften all that is rotted of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Then you should repeat the application of Egyptian ointment on that wound second and third time if necessary, so long as you are sure that there is no cause of that rotted skin remaining  then treat the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an ulcer contains a fatty node, then you should cut into that according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a cross-shaped section, and cut between the two lips of the section and slice that in every part, and use your strength in extracting the membrane which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if an artery causes you trouble, then do what I told you before.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the case of a lapsified ulcer with section and treatment according to what we have said  and a section on a lapsified ulcer is less painful, for it has little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes some of these ulcers in the head are found in some people in which there is not moisture  and the cause of that is when someone hits an ulcer on the head of an old woman and find the ulcer like hard, rough, white stone which could not be pierced, and if someone hits it, it bleeds.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other accidental ulcers in the head, this is not the case, as in the ulcers that come to the heads of children due to teething, and the cause of them are the teeth  but the section of all these should be a superficial section.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the piercing of those from their lower parts so that the body can be separated from the sanies in their lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is suitable for their cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulas that occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these ulcers occur in the neck and armpits and angles  and sometimes they appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and many are engendered among them  and every scrofula of those is within its own membrane, and thus with the nodes and ulcers of the head, as we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the tissues of these scrofulas are many, for some of those are lapsified, and others contain moisture, and still others are malignant and don't obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that which you see good disposition in the Touchment, of which the color of what is manifest is close to the color of the skin, and is not swollen in any part, and is not annexed by the nerve of the neck or veins or artery, and is not profound  then you should probe that with a superficial section from above to below from the line .G. between the lines .B., and scrape that off of every part, and cut between its two lips with an incision, or with many incisions if you have need of them, as we have said in the ulcers of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that a vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.
