And be careful that your hand not slip when you cut, or else it will hurt the patient, and cut what is not necessary to cut  for if you cut a vein or artery and prohibited from your operation, then apply on the wound vitriol ground or other powders which stop flow of blood, and bind the wound tightly, and leave that until the acuteness of the ulcer subsides and the wound softens and begins to be suppurated.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there is any cause of the other small scrofulas, therefore cut those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the great scrofula vein, then you should not cut that scrofula from its roots.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But before you must lie that down with strong folded cloth and let it be so that it falls by itself without causing harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old wine which you have already mixed with Egyptian ointment  then treat that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut that scrofula completely, then you should bring the two lips of the wound together and bind them so tightly that there is no superfluous discharge.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluous discharge due to the size of the scrofula, then you should understand how to cut its root  and open it up and treat that with suture and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the scrofulas that contain moisture, pierce that with superficial piercing where it appears to you as the site of its maturation, and pause piercing of what is drawn from the bottom of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then treat that with piercing, cauteries with ointment and similarly to those  so that it softens what is rotted from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	Then when you see the wound already cleaned, then treat that with ointment of generative flesh so that it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the lump of the apothema accidentally within the throat.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients described this incision in the epiglottis, and I have not seen anyone in our land who has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those men:
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have squint, whoever performs the extraction of the epiglottis, by which all the veins and the main ones of the patient are here, should be avoided.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have apothemas in the mouth or throat or two ears, when the malady is not in the windpipe, one should use the incision of the epiglottis to avoid the loss that is caused by puncturing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore when we want to do this, we should cut the epiglottis below three circles of the circles of the epiglottis or four with a small incision for the width in that one which is between two circles for quantity, and the incision should be in the pharynx not in the cartilage, and that place is suitable for incision because it is deprived of flesh and its blood vessels are light.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is fearful, then he should extend the throat with an instrument and cut the membrane until he reaches the windpipe, but avoid the blood vessels if for some reason he sees any of them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then cut the membrane according to what we have recommended; and it is signified about the incision of the windpipe by the flame which goes out from that which is split in two, and also by the breathlessness.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore when the time has passed in which piercing is feared, bring together two lips of the wound's membrane and sew that alone to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines which cause the flesh within to grow so that it may heal.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the speech which we have recommended is that some of those apothemas have oppressed the throat of the patient and the patient has died within, and his breath has become weak, and some want to cut the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the wound by some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that he commands to leave the wound open until the wickedness of the malady is consumed; and its wickedness lasts three days; and then he commands to sew up the wound and heal that which is within.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen by my servants is that a servant placed a stick and touched it in his throat and cut with it a part of the windpipe of the lungs, and he was called to heal him, and he found the breath just as it is breathed by the dead, and he discovered the wound and found the blood which had flowed from the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Then he confessed that he had not cut any vein or nerve and the breath came out from the wound and he healed that which was within so that it may be healed by fire.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And he did not listen to the servant unless he vomited in his mouth, and after some days he returned to the healing of his own dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now he says that in the incision of the epiglottis there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision on apothema which occurs in the external throat and is called a hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This apothema named hernia of the throat is a large apothema according to the color of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one has no remedy.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two ways, for one of which is like grassy nodes and the other way is like apothema which is caused by constriction of an artery, and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And let no one make presumption with him unless with an iron needle except in that one which is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe him and examine him with the needle, and if you find it like a grassy node and not suspended by any of the veins, then you cut that one just as the nodes, and extract that from which the skin and membrane; but if not, then scrape all his being, and heal the place with that which is suitable for healing.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the incision of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many species of nodes and I have already said all of their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And let him who tells you the difference between a node and an exitura with doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that with exitura there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluity ceases; and putrefaction is completed when the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a node there is no heat or fever or pain, and count that phlegmonic lion which is in the own bag.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is with a ulcer and it occurs thus with a pustule, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species for one is grassy and contains humidity, and the colors of humidity are many, as I described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore when you come to the healing of a node, probe that and examine that at its beginning with an instrument which is called intromes according to what its form comes in the chapter which is nearby.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of inquiry of apothemas and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and insert that into the most humid place which you find in the apothema, and you turn your fingers with that little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then close your hand according to the measure of the size of the apothema, and extract the intromes and consider that which is flow out in its trail.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the humid matter flows out, of whatever color it is, then you cut that superficially just as I said in the other apothemas.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trail of the intromes you do not get out humidity, then know that it is grassy.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it with incision having the form of crosses according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	just as you taught him, and suspend that with hooks, and scrape the membrane from all parts with ease, and guard the skin or bag over that if you can, and extract that pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is torn in the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus and many times there, then you extract it at intervals until from it nothing leaks out for any cause.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if from it no leak out anything for any cause, little or much, the node returns according to the may.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that from it leaks out a little part, then complete the wound with some strong corrosive powders and close the wound, and pause over that which apothema cauterized, and heal that by another cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node then you cut the two lips of it and heal that which is flesh.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the vein is contrary to it, or not pulsating, then you close and cover the place of zegi trissat which is vetriol and let that lie there for two days or three until its pus becomes thin and the boil of the blood; then return to cut that which is swollen of the node.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the breasts of men who are like women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's breasts are swollen due to sleepiness like women, and then the breasts are inflated, and they are like women's breasts, and they are Roman.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if one who eats it, let him cut that according to the lunar incision from line .B. to line .G., and then remove the whole groove, and fill the wound with medicine, and then join the two lips of the wound with a stitch, and cure it.

But if the breast sags to the sides and is softened by its weight likewise with women, then it is split into two parts like a figure of the moon, each part contained in the other according to the form from line .B. to line .G.; and then remove the cod, and the pus, and administer what has been said about the stitch and the powders which is necessary in the cure until it is healed.

And if you do not complete the incision of that which you must cut due to the unease of the patient, and due to the flow of blood, then fill the wound with cotton saturated in a corrosive ointment and lay it in that which corrodes like rust, and then cure it.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of piercing of abscesses which come from below the titties.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	The abscesses which come from below the titties are of the species of scrofulas, hard, they contain one pimple which is loose.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the incision of abscesses that occur through an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	And the signs by which inflammation and abscess are known to be through an artery or vein: for when the abscess is through an artery, it is long drawn out in the body; and when you press on the abscess with your fingers, you feel a pulsing in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is through a vein is round at its appearance in the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And an incision on this abscess is dangerous, especially in that which is below the armpits, and in the elbows, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very great, therefore its cure by cauterization should be avoided, and also that which is in the extremities or the head.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But on that which is above due to inflammation of the opening of the artery, make an incision in the vein along its length; and then open up the incision with tweezers, and free the artery from the membranes so that it may be exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put a needle into it and make it penetrate to the other side, and constrict the artery with a double thread in two places, — which will cause you to see that in extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then plug up the place between two membranes with spongy material so that the blood will all flow out of it and the abscess be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which pus is engendered until the membranes fall away, and then cure it with suitable ointments until it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the abscess is through an incision of a vein, then you should hold that which is by your hand to the abscess with the vein, and then thrust in the needle below the place which you have held by your hand, and make it penetrate; and have in it double thread so that you may extract it from the other side, and then tie off the abscess with good membrane according as I have said to you about the ligature of two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that you will pull out the thread, then put in the thread with that needle below all of the abscess down to the incision of the first needle, and constrict your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry up the abscess in its middle so that when it has come out of it, then you pierce the superfluity of the vein and leave that which is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then put on it powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with cauteries and ointments until it heals.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 of the abscess which occurs from a twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	So too abscess occurs in an artery and vein, and similarly abscess occurs in nerves when they occur with a blow or occur from excess heat, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made in the places of the assistants or the leg, or in any place in which the joints are bruised.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a heavy abscess, and it is like the color of the rest of the body, and in its greatest part there are no pulsations from it, and when it is pressed with strength, the patient feels a stupor in it.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess drawn out in the body, and therefore it is below the vein, and it is bruised all over and does not go before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore that which is in the joints should not be cauterized with a hot iron, for it would quickly bring about contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is in the head or forehead open up the vein with spongy material.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a minor abscess, then cut it with scissors and dig out its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is great, then suspend it with a hook and gouge out that, and then stop the bleeding; and tie off the wound with a suture, and cure it until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the incision of the abscess which occurs from a hernia that occurs in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	And it occurs in some men many times in bellies and other parts of the bodies of those who are called funguals because of their likeness to mushrooms, the roots of which are subtle and their heads are large; and already their lips are conversed, and they are small, and they are great.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one, and in his belly were two tumors which were like mushroom-like, and there was no difference between those white ones, of fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were inverted and split, and moisture ran from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I cut into them and probed in at the one in feet, 15 inches. and the other 6 inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation at its incision is that you consider whether the patient is cold, and the color of the wound is white, moist, with subtle roots; then you open it up with spongy material, and let it be cauterized in the fire, for many times pus is expelled from it after its incision; and if the blood comes out, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is fearful and nervous, beware of an incision with a hot iron; but then take a recently made thread of lead, and constrict that wound, in the manner which I have said; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tie off in the constriction of the lead wire; therefore do not cease to tighten the large lead wire on the tumor until it has been dug out and has fallen away by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the tumor is of coarse roots, then in its incision there is some cause of fear and terror, and especially in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you cut into its matrix, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not presume to cut into a tumor which is of dusky color, of little feeling, of light weight, for such a one is an abscessed cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come again with remembrance of cancer, apropos.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of preeminence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Preeminence of the navel is caused by many things; or by fissures in the septum which is over the belly, and there are from it the membrane or hernia according to what comes before in other ruptures; or by blood which flows out of a vein or artery as was said before, or by constricted distention within it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by a fissure of the septum and by splitting of the membrane, then the color of the abscess is like that of the body; and there are in it pains, and then appears in various positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by extrusion of the hernia, then its positions are like that which we have recounted, in more violent diversity, and when you press it with your fingers it is concealed, and then returns; and it is strong within it, and is great due to the entry of foments and vehement work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if due to humidity it is slippery and not hidden when you touch it with your hand, nor is it constricted or stuck.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then these signs will appear as the ulcer turns black.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to flesh, then the ulcer is heavy, large and hard, and it feels like a certain quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to windiness, then the touch of it is slippery.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider whether the protruding navel is due to an arterial or venous wound, or due to windiness; then you must abstain from treating it, for in that place there is fear and danger as I have taught you in the chapter where I said about ulcers from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the navel's protrusion is due to the intestine or hernia, then you must command the patient to hold his breath and be standing upright; and then sign with your finger around the entire navel, and then command him to breathe in while you hold your hand over his chest, and then gently push the hernia back in with a strong ligature or a bandage, and the way of binding decently.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended ulcer over the hernia and put your finger into that opening and seek out the intestine; and if you have caught it or held it by the ligament, then pull it out gently and push the intestine back inside the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you've caught the hernia, then take that by the inch; and cut off the excess of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is against your artery or vein, then surround that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put on them strong threads and insert the two needles into the circuit which you have made around the ulcer in the way of a cross, making the needles penetrate; and then tighten the ulcer in four places over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, take out the needles and let the extended flesh fall back and heal by itself; or insert into it what is subtle and healing, and then treat that spot with what is suitable for the wound to heal.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the navel's protrusion is due to flesh in it or humidity, then you must hollow out the ulcer as we have said and extract the blood or humidity which you find in it, and then treat that spot with what is suitable for it to be consolidated.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure of hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, of the kind of hernia and in what manner there is a way to its cure by medicines, and that it is cured in it by iron without being ulcerated; and we have said that hernia is engendered in the mother and cautery of its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes hernia is in a place where its removal is possible, like hernia in the breasts or in the groin and to those similar members allocated to be extracted entirely, especially when it is started small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you must not approach it, for I have not seen that ulcer healed nor have I seen anyone else do so.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it is when it is allocated as we have said, is that you precede and let the patient fast and purge black bile sometimes, and then cut that spot if a manifest fullness is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with a preparation in which he is located for operation, and then insert nails into the wound which are suited to that spot; and then hollow out every part with a good sharp saw without breaking any cause of the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood flow, and do not bandage that loosely, and express the spots, and wipe away the thick blood with your hand or an instrument by which it is possible for you of instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it does you harm from thick blood flowing from an artery or vein, then cauterize that spot until the flow of blood stops, and then treat that spot with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of hydrocephalus.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, of the kinds of hydrocephalus from water and the signs of each kind, of its cure by medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured by iron is only the kind of althitas alone, and it is not approached by iron to the kind of timpanistes or to the kind of yposarcha, for that is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this kind of hydrocephalus timpanistre with medicines and your treatment does not work, then consider, for if the patient has already achieved weakness or is suffering from another malady or hydrocephalus, like that which is in the head or chest and similar to those, then beware that you do not treat it with iron, for there is danger over that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient suffering from vertigo profuse, and in him there is no other malady but hydrocephalus only, and neither child nor old person, then the manner of its operation is that you raise the patient between your hands, and then press his belly with your hand, filling the water to the part below the navel, and then take a pointed spatula according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It is of two pointed parts long, of acute end as spatula; but indeed it has in it some brevity little by little, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the intestine, and that you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydrocephalus is from parts of the intestines, for then you must with the section lengthen the navel to the quantity of three fingers to the parts below, in the right of it over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrocephalus is from malady of the liver, then your section is left of the navel for three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is from the bile, then your section is on the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And beware that your section is over the side over which the patient wants to lie so that the excess does not flow to that spot.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument all the way through, and insert into that section, and raise your hand with the spatula between the navel and the hypochondrium, and you express that; and if it is the quantity of a fingernail or finger width.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the hypochondrium so that the spatula reaches the place it wants to go, and it is the location of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	And it is similar to a subtle silver cannula; it is made of silver or brass or lead wire, and at the lower end of it there are two small holes: one from one side and one from the other side; and its end is split according to the manner of a feather, like this:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper end of it there is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately slides over the instrument, therefore emptying from the water in the hour small quantity, for if you empty from that more than that does not befell in the hour, strongly harm the patient by resolution of his animal spirit, or accideth to him death which is approaching.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	Now evacuate him according to the amount of his strength and according to what you know about the disposition of his sickness, the strength of his pulse, and his overall health.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then remove the instrument and retain the water which causes it; as soon as it is retained by the cord, which holds the wound over the head of which you are told to pierce, according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the instrument on another day if the patient can tolerate it, and extract a small amount of water, and do this for several days out of caution, and beware of error until the water is hardly flowing at all.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you are concerned about the patient and leave out a great deal of water, then treat that wound with quicklime in sand, move it in a bath, and expose it to the sun for a long time; and treat that with drying medicines until it is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize the stomach and the meld, and the vein from which the water is extracted, according to what I have recounted in that which precedes.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the treatment of children who are born with a hernia in the urinary tract.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes, some children are born from their mother's womb and the top of their head is not broken through (or it is a narrow crack or it is in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Thus, treat it with a break right after it is born with a very subtle move according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then put into the crack a thin lead nail and tie it there, and leave it for three days or for .iiii.tre.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, let him be milked and urinate; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not put in the lead, then it is possible that the urine which goes over the place will not harm this closure.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But he whose crack is narrow should be treated with a lead nail as we have said for several days until it is enlarged.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But he who is born and the crack is not in its proper place, it has been cut, which is the cause because from him, that which is born and the crack is at the end of the head of the penis so that he cannot urinate inside, while he raises the penis with his hand to the parts above; and there is no generation for him, because the sperm cannot reach the mother according to nature, and it is a very bad disease.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation on him is that the patient be laid on his back, and then stretch the head of his penis with your left hand with a strong extraction, and push in the head of the head of the penis at the foreskin with a pointed object, as one pricks with a feather, or that you scratch any part so that the skin of the penis comes to resemble the head of the penis and that the crack falls into the appropriate location according to nature.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware that in your operation there is no bleeding, for many times it happens; and give to him what you have used to stop the bleeding, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 56.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of whitlow which happens in the foreskin on the head of the penis and of corruption, and blackness, and adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this whitlow happens in the penis and is an excess of flesh.

Not-malignant, that you suspend with a very thin thread and cut it off so that that whole part is removed; and then put on that cut area a suppository of Egyptian ointment; and then that will cure itself with the ointment of diafinicon until it is healed.

And indeed, sometimes it happens in the testes and in the foreskin blackness and corruption, then you should remove all that which is blackened and which wants to become corrupted or that which is already corrupted; and then spread over that with ointment, which is ground with flour of the shell of pomegranates and of husks beaten and strained.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then cure that with the other treatment until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is bleeding, then administer lunar cauterization according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	for the cautery of juice is good for two things at once, that is for bleeding and for the wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is腐 and destroyed all at once, then you should insert into the foreskin a lead cannula so that the patient can urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin with the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in him whose foreskin is cut, and on him circumcision is not performed; and when it happens by plague or by pustule) let you open it with a blunt object so that the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is released from all parts.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to tear them apart, then you should cut with a pointed object some part of the head of the penis and of the foreskin; and so it is because the foreskin, when it is thin, easily pierces the penis through its thinness.

And then separate the foreskin from the head of the penis with a very thin membrane, which is already moistened in the water that was rubbed so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then let it be cured with green vitriol until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and of the treatment of what happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a cure for continence like other diseases: but however, since it is of our operation and of our will, and it comes from that more naturally in children, it is necessary that we assign to it better operation and use the easier way and lose the more difficult one for health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore we say that the ancients did not use circumcision in some of their free ones, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the cause of which is that I have proven the majority of the artificers and of the barbers using circumcision and purification with a knife and with torches; and they use cement for the seal and incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already proved all these ways and found better purification with forceps, with cement at the seal that is made with the nail in purification with the nail, because many times the membrane of the foreskin comes above, because the membrane of the foreskin has two tunics, and the thick one below, and it is very easily forced to another incision and secure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification which is done with the tweezers, and it is digital, of which the surgeons use, it is not secure to make an incision at the end of the virile member, for it often goes into the hollow of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in operation with the nail, very often iron and corruption are caused by your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the umbilical cord of a child is short by nature, and in many cases is cut in such a way that it does not require cleaning, and I have seen this myself.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But about the cleaning that is done with tweezers and thread using soap, I have discovered through experience and experiment, because the tweezers are of a proportional size, so the sharpness that is above is like the sharpness that is below; and therefore when you press your fingers in proportionate ways, and insert them according to a comparison at one time; and compression is made of the thread with the shape containing the umbilical cord entirely cut through, with which there can be no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the way of the first operation is that you make the child stay mostly upright if it is one of those that I understand a little, and do not move but only tie the thread in its umbilical cord as much as you can, and leave it until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	Then do that which will make him happy in every way that is possible for you to do so as one who receives his understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	Then make the child stay between your hands in a prepared manner, and do not be hesitant; and conceal the tweezers in your hand or under your foot so that the child does not see those or any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	Then insert your hand into the umbilical cord and blow into it, and draw out that which is inside so that the head of the umbilical cord comes out, and then clean that which has accumulated in it as filth.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	Then tie the marked spot with a double thread, and then tie it lower down a little bit with another thread, and then have your fingers ready at the spot of the thread below with good retention, and insert between two threads.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then elevate the umbilical cord gently and stretch out the head of the umbilical cord; then let the blood flow little by little, for it is better that way; and place powder on top of it and over the powder place a cloth in which is spread mulberry gum in rose water mixed with recent olive oil; and leave that on there until the next day; and cure that with ointment until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the tweezers for cleaning, this is their shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let the ends not be cut and the others be cut, so that the nail is not cut, and let the length of both sides be as long as two handles equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the mistake in the cleaning is that the umbilical cord intrinsecally entirely escapes or is torn from its insertion.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Then cover that part of it with your finger nail before the insertion of the spot and insert that according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then grab it with a needle and insert it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if it is passed three days and that which is inflated below the umbilical cord remains, then you leave that until the swelling of the aposteme has gone down, and cut it with ease, and insert that according to how you are prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And be careful of the head of the umbilical cord because it will not hurt him.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	Then cure that with what the plague is consolidated by the powders which we have counted in the treatise of powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the umbilical cord beyond measure, and obeys the parts above, that will not hurt him.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	But cure that with what we have said before so that it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by oppression made by stone or by blood clot, or by tumor or by swelling, and they are similar to those of what we have said about the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved and the retention of it is due to a stone which already is in the neck of the bladder, then have the patient bend over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Then press the patient's feet against his back and raise his stomach from the part above his back as far as it is possible for him to do so.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Then the neck of the bladder is constricted and the stone is expelled from the parts behind, because the urine is released.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved by what we have said and the cause is made more vehement upon the patient, then have him given an extraction of it with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is its form: Let it be of silver and let it be thin, as well as the needle of an owl's feather to be thin in length like a long needle, to whose head is a pipe of reed with a thin cane in the shape of a long needle, to which is a pipe of reed with a thin cane in the shape of a long needle, to whose head is a pipe of reed with a thin cane in the shape of a long needle.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the way of the exit of the urine through it is that you take a folded cloth and tie it in the end of it with wool or cotton with good binding; and insert the ends of the cloth into the part below the syringe, and insert it with tweezers if any superfluous cause from the wool, but insert it into the reed with force. And then tighten the syringe with a bowstring and with egg white of an eagle.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And let the patient lie on his back, and open the bladder of him and the umbilical cord with oils, olive oil and eggs.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	Then insert the syringe with ease into the place where it reaches to the root of the umbilical cord; and then bend the umbilical cord above at the part of the embelic; and then grab the syringe in that place; and then grab that until it reaches the bladder, and that which is empty of the cause, and do not do so according to this order, but let the meat go into a tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	Then extend the cloth with the wool little by little, because the urine soaks up the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then pull out that and let the urine be released by cure, and use the syringe; do not cease to do this and use the syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient feels better.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of quality of catheterization of the bladder with a catheter and with similar instruments which are in accordance with that.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When ulcers or apostemes occur in the bladder, or blood clot in it, or swelling is contracted there, and you want to distill water and medicines into it, then let that be done with an instrument which is called a catheter, and this is its form: Let it be of silver and let the needle be thin, as well as the needle of an owl's feather to be thin in length like a long needle, to whose head is a pipe of reed with a thin cane in the shape of a long needle.
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But if in its end it is dull, then it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three holes: two of the one part, thus alike.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning it is a hollow place in which it is inserted, and let there be according to quantity that it pushes out that, its addition, within that when any cause is pulled from the moisture, it is pulled out, and when it is expelled long, according to how the catheter makes naphtha phlegm in sea battles.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Then when you want to propel moisture into the bladder, insert the end of clapcedra into the moisture and pull it with that which is pushing on the parts above, because the moisture is pulled in the hollows of clapcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	Then insert the end of clapcedra into the umbilical cord according to how we have described in the syringe; and then grab the moisture with what you grab it, because that moisture comes to the bladder as quickly as possible, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The form of the subtle crucible through which the bladder is crystallized, and that is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it should be made of silver or brass, the top part being shaped like a small feather, and from there it narrows into a tube.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	Then take an animal bladder, and place within it the humidity that you want to crystallize in the bladder, and tie that tightly with a strong double ligature, and heat that humidity over a fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	Then insert the tip of the crucible into the urethra.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then squeeze your hand over the bladder with the humidity inside, tightening it with all your strength as the patient urinates, until that humidity has entered the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you don't have a bladder, then take a piece of parchment and make a circle out of it; and pierce that all around its circumference; and insert a strong needle into those holes, so that it can be rotated; and add the circle as well as the soft part, because when you place it onto what you want of the humidities, oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that in the instrument and do with it as you did with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity enters the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60:
De extraccio de peyra.	On the extraction of stones.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already spoken in the division of stones, about their kinds and cure with medicines, and the difference between a stone generated in the kidneys and one generated in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have spoken of the stone which requires operation with the hand, and incision.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly speaking is that one which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And for this we will relate the manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that a stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to infants; and its signs are that the urine which exits from the bladder is like water in its thinness, and appears in it sand; and the patient rubs his penis, and often passes water, and then is relieved; and with this there is formed a lump in those places.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the cure of children who have reached 14 years is easy; and it is difficult to cure the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young, it is rendered smaller by what is between them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And if the stone is large and its cure is more difficult, then it is the contrary.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore when we come to the cure of that, we must first cleanse the patient with a crucible which extracts everything in his intestines; because that fissure sometimes blocks the expulsion of the stone through investigation.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then the patient should be pressed on his feet and coughed and bent over so that the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or jumps from one place to another.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then let him bend his head down between your hands, and let the patient's head be below, so that the whole bladder is made to decline towards what is below.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then push it out entirely.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, then at once make incision over him.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it does not at all come out through your touch, then let you anoint with oil the tip of your left index finger on the patient, if he is an infant, or the middle finger if he is a young man, and insert that into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And push out the stone as it lies below your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually turn that into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on it with your finger, and expel that out through the place where you made incision.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the assistant to press the bladder with his hand; and command another assistant that with his right hand extend the testes towards what is above, and with his other hand re-open the scrotum which lies below the testes, in the part where incision is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert a spathule, of which this is its form:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut into him what is between the anus and the testes, not in the middle place, forward to the left side of the scrotum; and let the incision be over that stone, and let your finger be in the anus, and let there be made a transverse incision, so that the incision coming out be ample and its going in be narrow according to the amount of the stone which it is possible for the patient to bear, and not more, because if you press too hard with your finger which is in the anus the stone will burst from within.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is some stone of which its angles and margins are such that the expulsion from it is difficult because of that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that one is like a onion, and is round, and there is made easier expulsion from it.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if the stone has such angles and margins that they fit in the fissure,
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	and if it is not pushed out then let you push on that, or press upon that with decent gestures, the end of which be thus with a file, and do not open from him; or insert below him a slender instrument with a curved end.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot push out that stone, then let you enlarge the wound a little, and if you see blood flowing, bind up that tightly with a band of linen soaked in vinegar.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.
