But if the stone is more than one, then at the beginning push your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it there; and then push in a little there; and act likewise as though they were two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very great, then it is not prudent to insert that with a large incision, because it happens to the patient one of two causes: or that he dies, or that he receives into himself a continued distillation of urine, because the place is not entirely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But let the assistant expel it as soon as it is pushed out, or draw it in the fracture of him with tongs so that he draws out that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore when you have finished your operation, then fill the wound with gum of aloe and dragon' s blood, and bind that tightly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place over that a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rose oil and water, so that the wound may be healed by cauterization.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then let the patient lie on his back, and do not loosen the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that has been loosened, wash the wound with water and oil, and then cure that with ointment of theriac and ointment of diapulmon within so that it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound occurs cauterization, dryness and corrosiveness, and of that there are signs as though the blood is frozen in the bladder and because of it the urination is prohibited (and that is known through the going out of blood with urine), then insert your finger into the wound and expel that blood, for if the bladder is provoked to putrefaction of the bladder and of him.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with wine, water and salt, and let it be bound up with every kind of bandage so that it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And let there be the hours of all the cure that you lie with both scrotum and bind up the medicines which are laid upon the wound.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and lodged in the urethra, and there is urination prohibited, then cure that with what you have already mentioned before there was incision, because forces have been applied for this cure, and it has been proved; and now take a bore of iron wire, of which this is its form:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular shape, acute, placed in a stick.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take the gall bladder and tie it with a thread under the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the iron into the stone, piercing it easily with the piercer until the piercer comes out of that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And gradually turn the piercer with your hand in that stone so that you make the piercing of it go in until you make the one on the other side penetrate; for then the urine is immediately expelled.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand on that which is broken of the stone of the exit of the thread, for that is cracked and is pierced by the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not prepared for you for some reason which prohibits it from that, then tie one thread under the stone and another thread above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then tighten your hand on the stone between those two threads.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then pull that out.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the thread and clean the congealed blood which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to have the thread under the stone except so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other thread above except that when the thread is untied the stone will come out of its place and close the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that it is necessary when you tie the thread above to raise the scrotum up or that it returns back with its proper movement and closes the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of stone extraction of women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Few stones are generated in women.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if you see a stone in any of them, then the cure for it is difficult and is prohibited by many ways.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman is very virgo.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman who knows how to uncover if she had sexual intercourse with a husband or is one of those women who have husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you will not find a woman who knows this art well enough to perform the operation with your hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision on stones in women is distant from the place of the stone so that it is difficult to cut with a knife and there is fear in that.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity forces you to do that, then know that you must take a woman who is well versed in medicine and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that then seek medicine which is both quick and subtle or present a midwife who is practiced in the affairs of women or a woman who in this art has learned the science.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	So do that presentation and command her to do everything that you tell her from the inquiry about the stone at the beginning; the cause is so that she examines if the woman is a virgin then know that she puts her finger into her vagina and feels for the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	So if she finds it then stop that under her finger and then command her to insert her finger into it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin then command the midwife to put her finger into the vagina of the patient and feel for the stone for as she puts her left hand over the bladder and press that with good pressure.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	So if she finds it then know that gradually she pulls down that from the orifice of the bladder to the openings below with the sum of her strength so that it comes out at the root of the scrotum.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert the tip of the knife into the orifice of the vagina behind the root of the scrotum from whatever part it is stopped at and fix the stone in that opening so that the finger does not slip on the stone.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be little at the beginning and then insert the needle into that incision and if she feels the stone then increase the incision according to the amount she knows that the stone is dropped from it.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of stones are many for there is a small and large stone and smooth and rough one and long and round and having horns.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	So you know how many species there are of it therefore you indicate about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see blood flowing then apply a little vitriol to the place and hold it there for an hour until the blood is dried and then return to your operation until the stone comes out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare for yourself instruments which are used in the extraction of stones in men so that you are helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see blood flowing and know that the emission of blood is from the artery which is cut then you place powder over the place and apply a bandage on it with pressure and do not go further in that; and draw out the stone and do not pull it for the patient will surely die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	So when the cutting of the blood has stopped then after a few days if the place is healed then return to your operation until the stone comes out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter lxii.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision on acute hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Aqueouz hernie is not but an accumulation of moisture in the white cauldron which is under the scrotum and it is called cauldron.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some are in the proper skin which nature has prepared it in the orifice of the scrotum so that there is a new scrotum and it is not but an ulcer.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness which happens in the muscles for there is effusion of that matter in those and some happen by beating done on the testicles.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has many colors for the color of it inclines to yellow or to bloody red or to red or is black and slimy and that is what happens most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which you know that this accumulation of moisture is so because if it is in the white cauldron then the ulcer is round and declining a little in length like the figure of a scrotum and appears the testicle for the moisture contains it on all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the proper skin then the ulcer is round at the orifice of the scrotum and from this one estimates that it is another scrotum.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the testicles and the white cauldron then cuts are made under it.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you want to know the color of the moisture then test the color of the moisture in the ulcer with a thread which has been burned so that its shape is preceded and judge from what comes out of it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	So when we come to the cure of it with iron then know that command the patient so that he is flebitic if that is possible for you and see the body of him.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then let it be pressed on his navel for some cause a little and place under it some woolen cloth.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then put your hand on his left side and command the minister to follow you on his right side and extend his rod at the testicles of the navel to the orifice of the abdomen.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a sharp knife and cut the testicles at their middle part for the length so that it is close to the orifice.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And let the incision be made according to the correct technique, equidistant from the line that separates the skin of the scrotum, until it reaches the white capsule containing the testicle.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	Examine it, and be careful not to cut into it; and let your incision have an opening that is suspended by the more thick and subtle humors, and scrutinize the incision according to the amount that you can.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	Then pierce the capsule full of water with a wide piercing, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	Then separate the two lips of the incision with your fingers, and extend the capsule upward; do not touch the testicle contained within, and cut into the capsule in whatever manner is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut into it to its entirety or in parts, and especially its subtle side; for if you do not examine the incision of it closely, there is no certainty that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the humors proceed from outside of its capsule in the moment of your operation, then when you have finished the incision of the capsule, return it inside, and then sew shut the two lips of the scrotum, and heal that just like the other wounds, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the humor corrupted by some other illness, then you should tie off the vessels which are over the suspensory ligament, extract the humor, and heal that just as we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is aggregated into two herniations, then know that there are two hernias; therefore cut into that hernia just as you have done in the other one equally; and if it appears to you to be one operation, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	Then you should cleanse the blood, and insert into the incisions wool which has been dipped in oil or rose-oil; and place outside another wool which you have dipped in wine and oil, and spread that over both testicles and the groin of the belly; and place above it doubled up cloths and powders, and tie those with a bandage which is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and let there be pressed two cloths and they are folded of colored wool according to this semblance; and let the extremities be made with which it is pressed of cotto or of wet wool, and let them be tied with tightness in the band of the undergarments, and one of the extremities take from the buttocks into the groin, and the second take to the part of the armpit, and two extremities over the two thighs and two other extremities over the two ankles, and all the tightness be adjusted in the band of the undergarments.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is medicated artificially by cautery instead of incision with an iron; and it is that you take a thin cutlass and that you cut into with that the scrotum of the testicles, and it is ignited according to what we have recommended until the white capsule containing the water is uncovered, and then you take cautery according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is similar to the Greek letter alpha.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	Then pierce with that capsule, and it is ignited until all the moisture is driven out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	Then extend the capsule with your fingers, and examine it with your fingers, and examine it with a thin cautery which is ignited; and cut into that just as it is possible for you until you have eradicated all of it; and be careful that the fire does not touch the humor.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is more safe and more distant from bleeding of blood, and better than operation with incision.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if it does opposition to you pustule cauterized in the hour of incision or in the hour of cautery, or bleeding of blood, then know that you heal whatever opposition it makes to you by that, with healing which is appropriate to it according to what is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is timid and does not expect a second operation due to his horror, then administer piercing according to what we have recommended that signified; and it is when you are certain through what we have said of the significations that this hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then know that you seat the patient over some elevated seat, then pierce the pustule in the part which is lowest on him with spatulum, and make the piercing according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the opening be wide so that all the water may flow out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	Then pause over the spot cotto and bind that and leave it, so that the remnant of the water runs out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then heal that until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if opposition is to the discharge of the water in that hour when you pierce it: and that is not done except that the white membrane in the orifice of the wound makes opposition and prohibits the exit of the water, then know that you put into the wound a needle or instrument by which the water is extracted from the hydrocele, the form of which is preceded; or adjust in the pression of the wound a small.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns, and is driven out again after about a month or more; and when it has occurred, then let it be pierced according to that same mentioned manner, for the patient will thus pass his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter .lxxxiii.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of incision on a fleshy hernia and its healing.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the incision on this hernia there is a fearful loss of life in the greater dispositions; for it has been seen to me its dismissal and to be saved by that better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I remember the operation on that and the properties of the pustules.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that the pustules are born in the bodies of which the testicles are composed and it is done for many causes: or due to acute sharp superfluity, which is effused into the testicles, or due to piercing.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And its color is according to the color of the body, and it does not ache in it, and it is a heavy pustule.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And often it is a pustule that has become lapsified, of which the color is dark, and there is no heat in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is done due to congestion of the veins, and due to inflammation of those thus as well as already having been perceived the memory of it, or due to inflammation of vessels.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But what is done due to congestion of the veins is known through the dispersion of the pustule when you compress that with your fingers; and it does not ache.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But what is done due to congestion of a vein is not dispersed from it any cause because of the compression with fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that on this species incision be made and on the other fleshy parts; and it is that you cut into the scrotum of the testicles, and then extend the humor upward, and extract that from the white capsule, and ligature them, and cut into the suspensory ligament more than you extract that from all parts of the parts of the humor.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore if the humor is already consolidated with those fleshy parts, then know that you extract the humor and cut into it.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion for some cause of the capsule, or between that which is between the vessels, then know that you release all that adhesion and cut into it by a round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is generation of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind, then know that you cut into all that is of it, and extract the humor thus as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore when your operation is complete, then fill the wound with wool dipped in rose-oil and wine; and then heal that with the other healing until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter 64.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	On the treatment of hernias that are wet.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	Wheat is an inflammation wrapped in some wrapper resembling a bud with softening of the testicles, and it makes difficult movement, exercise, and ambulation for the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this ailment, there is fear of what precedes it, for which reason there is a reminder.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, we will discuss the second one later, as we did with the first.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that you should elevate the patient on a bed; and then tie the testicles to the lower parts; and hold the scrotum with your left hand while pulling up with your right; and keep the other assistant holding him by his arms, stretching them vigourously.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And you have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands. And then insert a sharp, broad knife horizontally into the right side of the vessels where they are exposed.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then hold the patient in such a way that the vessels are made to be dispersed and separated from each other by the knife. And then cut out, as we have said before, any arterials which are in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And if you find that the hernia is caused by hot humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And then insert a needle into those places, with a double thread, the first one at the front of the places where the wetness occurs, and the other one turned around at the back of them.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out. And insert them into the middle of that location with a right-angled cut according to the length of the body, and extract what is aggregated there of putrid and corrupted humours.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And if the hernia is caused by hot humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And then treat the wound with treatment for other wounds from which pus is meant to be generated so that the vessels which turn black from two testicles, it is not bad for that.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	And if the hernia is caused by cold humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. But if wetness occurs to all the vessels, then the testicles should be extracted or that the testicles, because of their separation from the vessels, be deprived of all nourishment through the incision of the vessels, and that they be withered, or separated so that there is no benefit to them.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the cure of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is through an incision that goes under the skull covering the belly, from the angle of the navel, so that it cuts into some of the intestines at that rupture.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And if you find that the hernia is caused by hot humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And this rupture is either of the skull or from an incision in it; and these two species occur for many causes: either from a blow, or from falling, or from crying, or from the elevation of something heavy, or similar.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And if the hernia is caused by cold humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And the sign of this, when it is from an extension of the skull, is that it occurs gradually over a long time, and does not occur suddenly, and there is wetness inside the abdomen because the skull compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And if the hernia is caused by hot humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And the sign of this is when it is from an incision in the skull, because at the beginning it causes very violent pain suddenly; and there is diverse wetness apparent below the neck, and that is because of displacement of the intestine, and the body of it towards the front at the edges outside the skull.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And if the hernia is caused by cold humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And sometimes it is forgotten with the intestine, and this hernia is called intestinal stranglehold.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is forgotten with the intestine because of displacement of the intestine and for another cause; and this hernia is called intestinal ring-like. And sometimes it is made by windiness, and sometimes there is a fissure in the intestine, and here it is retained, and there is great harm to the patient, and sometimes it causes bad and worse pain when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And sometimes it is made because of displacement of the intestine and for another cause; and this hernia is called intestinal ring-like. And in the treatment of these ailments with iron, there is fear, so that one should avoid the casting of that.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And if the hernia is caused by hot humours infiltrating somewhere in the body and pain occurs in some part of the body, then do a pointed cautery on the surface of the foot. And the manner of the operation for this is that you command the patient to push in the intestine with his hand towards its cavity if he obeys your instruction, and then he should be laid on his back between your hands, and raise up his legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then tighten the ligature which binds the ligature of the testicles to the parts above, and insert the ligature of the testicles all along; and place the hooks of the incision between two lips according to how you open the incision with them.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And make the incision according to the amount that is possible for you, so that all of the hernia is cut out.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And then cut away any excess tissue which is underneath the ligature of the testicles, while making sure that the white, hard surface of each part is exposed.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you put your finger into that which binds the testicle, where it is between the white surface and the surface of the hernia, and release with your finger any adhesions which are at the back of the hernia.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then use your hand to loosen the ligature of the testicles on the sides, and at the same time extend the white surface upwards with your left hand and lift the hernia with the surface towards the incision; and tell your assistant to stretch out the hernia inwards while you dissolve any adhesions behind it using a complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And check with your fingers that there is no cause for the intestine to be wrapped up in the white, hard surface.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find a cause on him, then you push it back into his belly.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then take a needle in which there is a large thread made of six threads, and insert it through the back of the surface beneath the ligature of the testicles, where the incision is; and then push the ends of the thread which are sticking out into the intestine so that there are four threads, and tie some of them into a cross shape; and hold with your hand the surface of which we said there is beneath the ligature of the testicles with strong forceps from two sides.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the ends of the threads and tie them with strong forceps so that none of the blood vessels which surround these can send anything through which an apoplectic stroke may not happen here.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And put another pair of forceps according to the first pair of forceps, long enough that it is three fingers away from him; and these two pairs of forceps will take away from the surface beneath the ligature of the testicles the amount of the size of a finger, and insert all around according to a round shape, and hold the hernia out.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then insert in the part underneath the ligature of the testicles by incision from which blood and pus will flow, just as we have recommended earlier.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool soaked in oil, and put it on the wound; and administer the forceps which we have recommended (and sometimes the white surface is cauterized where we said there is fear of a flow of blood, when several times this happens to them) and let go of the forceps so that by itself it falls.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if his healing is delayed, then let warm water be applied, and put it over him so that he falls according to what we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the wound with the other treatment of wounds so that it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66:
De hernia ventosa.	Of a hernial hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, I have not seen anyone who has been treated for it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first thing to do is that it is made as we have recommended in the hernia which is with the testicles; and which is to tie the vessels over there with ease for him; and then dry up the apoplectic stroke around it by opening it, while the vessels fall down.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And heal the wound as we have said so that it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67:
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the separation which is made in the throat.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there is a rupture in the throat as we have said, and the spot protrudes.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not let any cause of the intestines enter the throat; and if they enter, it is rare; and return from it in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with this, it is a wound in the surface where the intestine goes into the surface; and it happens because of the extension of the surface which is in the throat as we have said, and which cause is that the surface is stretched, and then softens and the spot protrudes.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure for it is by cauterization just as we have given the description of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured by iron in this way: and the patient lies on his back between your hands, and then dry up the spot of the rupture of the apoplectic strokes sticking out with incision according to the length of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white surface which is beneath the ligature so that it is exposed.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the thread and put it over the spot protruding from the surface, and press it against the front of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then sew the two spots sticking out at the end of the thread on the surface, and adjust with the stitch one of them to the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then pull out the end of the thread, and do not cut it from the surface at all, nor extend the hernia, nor any other cause as we have made you know in the cure for a hernial hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then heal that with the treatment of wounds, and as you insert the threads, cleanse it and restore the wound so that it is consolidated; because the surface is contracted and the protrusion of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this spot because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68:
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of softening of the ligature of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Sometimes the ligature of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh which is between there is softened, and it is felt that its guard is relaxed.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore it is necessary for that person who is treated in the cure for him to lie on his back according to how he feels, and insert all of the ligature which is softened over the natural ligature; and then sew two lips with a stitch.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, cut in the beginning the superfluity of the softened ligature with three or four cuts and with a firm stitch.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then insert between the stitches; and then heal by the treatment of wounds so that it is healed and the threads fall down.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69:
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is forbidden, but it was allowed to me that I remember it in this book; and the reminder of it is not necessary except for two ways, of which one is for the doctor when he is questioned about it, so that he knows how to cure it if it happens; and the other way is that we many times have needed castration of other animals for our young by them, as with horses, and oxen, and pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is made in two ways: either by traction, or by incision into an incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is made by traction, the way of the operation is that we make the animal lie in warm water so that his genitals are softened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand so that they are resolved and do not appear under the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration made by incision and wound, have the animal and press the ligature of his testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And now tie the suspension and insert it into each eye with a section in between where two processes are proceeding.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	Then insert those that you have scalded.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And don't put anything on the head, except for a subtle cloth which is over the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better when done by incision because a strong incision leaves no cause from the testicles for the animal to desire sex.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	Then cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70:
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure for hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two methods: the first is when there appears a space between the cords of the testicles, in that which is between two testicles; it looks like a woman's vagina with balls.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from this cord urine flows as well.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women there is only one type: the clitoris of a woman on her vagina is like two testicles of a man, a little at the entrance and as big as a pearl; and two testicles as well.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is with three remedies: two from men and one from women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And you shall insert those tight meats between which the moisture flows out; then cure those with the cure for the other wounds as well.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And the second type of men from which urine flows in the cord of the testicles has no cure or treatment for it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 71:
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of a hernia and protuberant flesh caused by women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	A strong hernia is tightly bound over natural causes until it is stressed and made tight like a rope: and sometimes it is enlarged in some women to the point that it spreads out as well as in men, and enters into intercourse.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Then if you have an excess of hernia, hold it with your hand or a bandage and insert it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not finish in insertion, especially at the tip of the penis, so that you don't experience blood flow.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	Then cure it with wound medicine until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	But protuberant flesh is flesh that grows in the womb of the mother until it fills up that space; and often it hangs out at the front like a tail (and for this reason some first called this "tailed disease"); therefore when we insert it, as we do with a hernia, let us cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72:
De curacio de alratica.	Of the cure for elephantiasis.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Elephantiasis is when the clitoris of a woman is not perforated, or has a small hole.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it can be natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to a disease that preceded it, and it is made by tightly bound flesh or a subtle wound or thickness.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it is made in the front of the mother' vagina, or in her ribs, or on top or bottom of her vagina, and it prohibits intercourse and impregnation and childbirth, and often prohibits menstruation as well.

And knowledge of it is made by examination by the midwife, if the opening is apparent, then push it in; but if it is not apparent, then you should pierce it with your needle or with a pin.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if the opening is due to a subtle wound and it is near both lips, then cut and break it open.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And you shall rest your fingers on both lips, and then insert your needle in the middle between both hands.

And the woman should be on her back, with her legs stretched out, and then stretch both lips so that the subtle wound is broken open and the opening is wide open.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And then take wool and dip it in oil and place it on the spot, and keep it warm with a cloth every day so that the incision is not closed up again.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the wound is large and thick, then you shall insert it with broad lye or with myrrh resin.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the opening is due to flesh, then suspend it with a bandage and insert that.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And have these remedies to stop the flow of blood without biting, like hemlock, and dragon' blood, and gum mastic, bound up with egg white.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	Then administer a broad lead rod so that the wound is not closed up again quickly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And hold it for several days and administer hot water from a bath.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	Then it is cured with the other cure of consolidation until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes accidents happen in childbirth due to other meats, and then insert according to this manner as well.

Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 73:
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	Of the cure of hemorrhoids and of a tail and of a red botul that happens in the clitoris of women.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are an appearance of orifices of veins from which blood flows continuously; and with them go old hemorrhoids as well.

Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr. Then take wool and dip it in juice of colander or in juice of arnagloza or in juice of gorse with wine and make it adhere to the spot; then cure the spot with unguents until it is healed.

Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 74:
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	Of a wound made accidentally in the mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many species of ulcers happen in the mother' vagina, like an ulcer and an ulcer with a tooth and an ulcerative ulcer and an ulcer with pus and a botul and a tail and others as well.

And here is what I think it means: "And now I will tell you in this treatise about the pustule called ' caut le qual ve en la mayre' (the one that appears on the mother's breast), and if you want to know how the operation of it is done with iron."
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	And now consider whether the pain of the pustule at its beginning is acute with percussion and phlegm and fever, and if you see that swelling and if it is on top of that feeling, then do not cut into it, and cure it with what helps in the maturation until that acuteness of the accidents cease.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And then you shall make the woman lie on her side that has two sides; and recline on his back and adjust his feet to the part most below the belly, and let his thighs be expanded, and place his arms below his elbows, and tie each with a bandage in whatever is convenient.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	Then the midwife shall follow on the right side and administer the instrument by which the opening of the breast is made, the form of which will come in those causes that are to be made properly.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	And when you want to administer this instrument, you shall put on the nipple of the woman's breast, and that which is inside the instrument should not be larger than the nipple of the breast and lead the patient.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the nipple of the breast, then you shall pause powders on the texture of the nipple of the breast so that it is prohibited that any instrument enter into the nipple of the breast.

And you shall put the vertitge that runs in the instrument from the side more above, and that the minister has the instrument and revolves the vertitge until the opening of the breast is made.

And when the pus is evacuated, then you shall put in the wound a poultice soaked in rose oil or oil with some astringency; and pause the cautery on the incision on the nipple of the breast.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And stop up the breast and over the bandage clean wool soaked in water in which there are bruised mallows.

Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter 75.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives in what way the live fetuses are to be treated when they come according to a non-natural figure.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	It is necessary that the midwife know in the beginning the figure of natural childbirth by signs of it, and it is that when you see the woman express at the parts below and desiring to smell the air, and over that she is stretched out because of that which is above her, and hastens the ejection of the fetus, then you should know that this part is according to a natural figure, and is its ejection over her head, and the second one with that or suspended or hanging from the umbilical.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	So when you see those signs, then the belly of it should be compressed so that the fetus descends lightly when they descend over her head, and the second one with that or suspended or hanging from the umbilical is washed of those superfluities by good washing.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu .i., o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But that which is other than this part is non-natural and not laudable, for when the fetus is ejected over its feet and the body of it is ejected before the head of it and the feet of it, and its hand one or to the foot of it .i.. or is ejected the head of it and its hand, or to the belly of it, and hard turned over his neck, and resembling figures of it non-laudable.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	So it is necessary that the midwife be wise and subtle in all those causes, and that she guard against error and deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I am showing you all figures of those, and what cunning is in those so that it be indicated by that and is standing over that.

When the fetus is ejected over its head by natural labor, and that is violent on the woman and is made to it difficult part, and sees the strength of it already debilitated, then make that cease , or that the women hold it, and evaporate the semen of it with fenugreek cut and with oiled humors.

Then the midwife shall insert between its fingers a little sponge and split with that the second one, or dry that with his nail until it runs out that which is in her of moisture.

And then command it, the midwife, that it is compressed and make that vomit with condition; and take its mouth and nose for one hour, for the fetus will be expelled immediately.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if the two hands of the fetus are expelled at the beginning, then you shall reduce those with little ease little by little.
