Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When complete dislocation occurs on any of the vertebrae of the back or neck and many vertebrae are removed from their places, then in this there is no cure, because death comes to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the excretion of the patient is outside his will, and he cannot retain it; and many times some of his members or both of his legs or both of his arms are made soft, or one of these; or a vertebra is displaced from its place, because many times it is displaced and the displacement of these is to four places.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, when it is displaced to the back parts, it is called hunchbackedness.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its cure is that then you should consider whether the hunchbackedness occurs from childhood, because then there is no cure for it and it has no complete healing at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that which comes from accident or concussion or similar to these, the Ancients have said their ways of cure with prolix speech, of which the most returns with profit; but I have already abridged and abbreviated that for the benefit of my hearer because of my proximity to my understanding and by which I have explained it and demonstrated it with diverse instruments.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in hunchbackedness which occurs from the front part of the feet, there is no healing for it; and similarly in that which is done on two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those are not healed except that which occurs properly in the back by what I have related.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient be extended on his face over a pillow so that his feet are not elevated.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight staff is placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the pillow around the head of him; and another staff is placed in the ground under his feet at the other end of the pillow.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister should hold the staff, and it should not be fixed in a hole; and another minister should hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then a bandage is wrapped around the head of the patient and under it the tongue of the lion is pressed tightly; and extend the end of the tongue to the staff which is under the head of him, and let that be in him; and then tighten the other bandage over his buttocks by his fingers, and let them be under his legs; and then adjust all the bandages and let them be in the other staff which is under his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each minister should extend the bandage to the end of the staff, and let the two staffs not be displaced from their places in which they are fixed, but rather not be fixed as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place his palms on the vertebra with strength until it returns to normal, or let him lie on a table, and then let him adjust his feet on the table until he returns to normal.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this way, then take a table of which the breadth or length is three yards long, and hollow out in the wall from which we have said it is near the patient a place into which extends the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then let the middle of the table be placed over the vertebra; and the doctor should place his feet on the other end, and stretch tightly until the vertebra is contracted and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want to, open with a windlass which is turned by hand; and let there be fixed in the ground two staffs of one yard long, of which the length between each staff is one palm, and there is made in each staff a hole in which the windlass turns; and each staff is fixed in the ground so that it is not displaced.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there shall be a round staff in which is the windlass, and let it be turned in the two holes of the two staffs.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end there is a hole in which the staff is formed, the length of which is one palm as it turns; and similarly in the other two staffs.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the bandages which you have tightened on the feet of the patient in the windlass which is under his head; and tighten the bandages which you have tightened on his buttocks in the turning which is under his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each turn and let a minister twist the turn by hand; and the doctor smoothens the vertebra as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the windlass:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the vertebra has returned to normal and the place is smoothed out, then let there be put over it a plaster made of white vinegar; and then let there be stopped with cloth; and then let him lie on the table of which the breadth is three yards or around that, and the length of it is the quantity which takes up the hunchbackedness, and over the place of the vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let him be bound with the bandage we have said, and the patient be given subtle food until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if some swelling remains in the place at the end of the healing, then let there be administered medicines which moisten and lubricate by administration of the table for a long time, which we have related; and in that place lead sheet has been administered.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes they will suffer from an imminence in the lower part of the spine, and it is considered to be due to that dislocation; and it is this bone which is affected by this medicine, and therefore you must not apply it again, as this could lead to their death very quickly.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscles are not intended for dislocation alone, but only occur in those which occur in other joints with slight displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways: it is dislocated internally or externally, or it can be dislocated forward or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is mostly dislocated internally, and rarely dislocated forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And a sign of its dislocation to the front is that when you straighten the patient's leg, it will be longer and more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their foot backwards, and there will be an apostemata around the hip joint from the cautery, indicating that the head of the hip joint has moved here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of which one it occurs to the back is that its accidents are contrary to those listed above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign that it occurs to the front is that they straighten their leg according to the compliment, but still cannot bend that foot due to pain; and if they try to walk on tiptoe, they cannot; and their urine is retained and they have apostemata around the joint, and they walk on their heels.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign that it occurs to the back is that they cannot straighten their leg or bend it forward due to pain; and their leg is shorter than the other, and the joint is softened, and the head of the hip joint has moved backward.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of this dislocation is that you should consider whether it is old and ancient, having been like that for a long time, that it will not be healed by simply reducing it and setting it in place; therefore, no medicine should be applied to it.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But for the one in which it is recent, and it is one of the four types of dislocation, then you should move the joint and extend it to the front and back, and from the right to the left, as this will quickly return and not require any further treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you should prepare to pull and extend the leg from the lowest part, either with their own hands or with a strap placed over the leg above the joint; and another person should hold the top of the leg below the patient's fingers while pulling upward, and another should press the lion-like strap against the root of the hip.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it is an extension from the front to the armpit, or from the back to the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And they should both be extended in one movement while the patient is raised from the ground and their leg hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension applies to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	So if the dislocation returns as we have said, all is well; but if not, then it is necessary to use any means possible to achieve the cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the proper reduction of it when it is dislocated and the dislocation is to the front, the patient should lie on their back; then place the strap over the root of the hip at the point between the head of the hip joint and the part below the armpit; and another person extends the strap above the armpit to the highest point of the collarbone.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another person should grab the patient's arms and press the hip joint strongly while another pulls outward violently, as this will return it to its proper place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this is the quickest cure by which that part is reduced more quickly than with other methods.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if you are not able to do this and cannot persuade them to use this method of cure for all parts, then at least tie both the patient's feet together with a strong strap, quickly, on their heels and toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each part should be four digits, and the leg with the dislocation should be extended more than the healthy one by two digits.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient's leg with the dislocation should be suspended from a beam above their head, and they should be in the middle position; and its length from the ground should be two arm-lengths.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And you should order a strong young man to push down on the head of the hip joint while another suspends the patient by their leg; and the other young man pulls up on the hip with force, as this will quickly return it to its proper place.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction when it is dislocated to the back, the patient should lie on their back with their leg bent as we have recommended earlier, and the strap should be tightly pressed against the dislocated hip and their foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two beams should be placed, one under each of the patient's feet, and the other under their head; and they should be adjusted so that a mat of dampened cloth is wrapped around the middle beam so that the patient will not be hurt by it being between their thighs, as otherwise the extension downward will be painful.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each person should extend their part, and the doctor should press down on the joint with his hand to guide the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So if you obey this instruction, all will go well; but if not, then pay attention to the following instructions and act according to what we have said about it earlier.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient should lie on their back comfortably.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front, then the leg should be extended slightly, and it is according to this narrative instruction that you press your right palm over the patient's armpit, and another person pulls upward on their foot while pressing downward on their shoulder; and with this extension, they will be pulled to the front toward the armpit.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back, then it should not be extended downward, but it should be raised up from the ground and placed on a hard surface; and if the hip joint is dislocated to the front, as we have said about its placement over two surfaces, then it will be elevated on its side with its leg extended, and its head will be turned back toward its chest, and the straps will be extended according to what we have said earlier.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it should receive compression with a board over the joint on which side the dislocation is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So when the reduction is complete according to what you see — and the sign of the reduction of it is not hidden from you, and it extends its leg with both feet, and when you see its joints bent and the dislocation expanded while the patient makes excuses, then you will know that the part has returned — and then you adjust both sides and press down on the hip joint and extend it with a band so that the hip is not bent in either direction; and let the patient rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then untie the bandage and the plaster, and bring one leg up to meet the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those wounds healing naturally, then know that the dislocation is cured and let the patient leave.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and bandage that, and stretch that according to your first stretching, and let that be for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then untie that, and let that delay walking for some days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure for a dislocation of the jaw.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The jaw is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated at the forward parts, and at the inward parts, and at the lower parts to the backward parts; and at the forward parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his jaw to his thigh; then you know that the jaw is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all of its manners is that you force the patient to lie down straight, so that he extends his thigh, if he can over it; adhere your two hands to his face, and place his foot between your feet; and then adhere his jaw with your palms, and hold those between your fingers over his jaw with strength, and another extend his foot while the jaw returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of its reduction is that his thigh adheres to the thigh with an easy, non-laborious elevation.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then bandage that and make the thigh adhere to the thigh, and then tie those together with a bandage for three or four days, and then untie those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And let the patient not use walking for some days, until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension with bandages from which in the cure of the hip a preceding narrative was given.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure for a dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle is sometimes dislocated by a small removal, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the complement; and its dislocation is made either at the inward parts or at the outward parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure for the removal of it is a gentle reduction, and that it be extended with ease with the hands and be poulticed until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated according to the complement, you see that the patient lies down straight, and that he holds a strong and valiant minister of the part behind his back at the middle place of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you with your right hand hold the highest foot, and with your left hand of the lower part of the foot at the place of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then with the left twice, and then extend it with the left; and press the foot of the leg with the right over the thigh six times.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that two times according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then press the foot of the leg to the thigh the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one time or two according to this manner, and if you see the foot swollen, that is good; and if not, then repeat the operation on him, for he will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if to you is prohibited the reduction of it with that which we have recommended, then let the patient lie on his back on the ground, and stretch a rope tightly in the ground, and that cord between his thighs, and you already have wrapped a cloth over him so that he does not slide.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then let the minister of it hold his thighs, and then another minister extend the foot with their hands or with bandages that lie over the nape of the neck; and then extend each minister against the extension of his pair, and let the cord be extended between the thighs of him holding that, so that the body of him is not drawn to the lower parts beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then let the doctor poultice the dislocation with their hands, and another minister hold the healthy thigh at the lower parts, for the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause bandage and stretch that with strong bandages, and tie the leg to the ankle.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And see that you are wary or guard the nerves which are behind over the ankle, lest the bandage over it be violent and lead that strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then let that be for two days or three; and if the bandage is softened, stretch that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then untie that on the third day or the fourth, and let the patient not walk for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk before that space, it is not made certain that the dislocation is not dissolved and ruined, and then let that not receive a cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if pus occurs to him, then let you minister to him in the healing of it that which in our preceding narrative we spoke of, in another place of cure and of poulticing, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure for a dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let that which is dislocated be swollen with little extension six times; and that which is difficult, let it be gentle.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some knuckles of the nape of the neck, then let the patient lie his foot on the ground or on a table, and be standing like that as if he was walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet and place your foot over that which protrudes from the joints, and then press it with your foot with strength while it returns, and see that it is swollen and does not protrude at the place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place under the nape of his neck a table which covers all the foot, to which are two caps, and then stretch that with decent and firm extension for three days; and then untie that and let him rest from walking for several days, until it is stretched out and its reduction is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocation that are made with sprain or with fracture or with whatever.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of those happens to you and you persevere in the cure of it and in its restoration, many times you will succeed death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore let not that you presume upon the cure of it, but that which is wise in the art, of long experience, merciful and compassionate, tardy, not impatient nor presumptuous; and use in the beginning of medicines that yield pus cauterizations only, and let the patient be at divine judgment, unless to which you hope salvation from perdition, with the alleviation of wickedness, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore strive you as soon as possible to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, before he develops pus cauterization.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according as you will, then minister medicine that yields pus cauterization and cures the sprain with that which is convenient for it of the swollen joints.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	If there is a dislocation with a fracture and bleeding in the bones of the joints, then you pierce their veins and do to them what we have said about simple diseases that precede those diseases in those locations.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your ability that instrument in the ways of fear according to what has been preceded by my preaching; for it is better for you to give praise to your Creator, and more permanent for your glory, and healthier for your true body those things in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Albucasim perfectly, of which God be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
